It makes owning and using it a real pleasure.  It's much easier than my iphone that I've had for 3 years and, the camera and video feature takes much better pictures than my digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Mary Jordan
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great. Super fast and very easy to use. Great product and a reasonable price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs Up!
Reviews.Author: Jim Spencer
Reviews.Content: I have bought Kindles since the original DX unit came out. I think I am qualified to say, since I have purchased in excess of ten or more Kindles, that I can say just what kind of deal they are. Amazon has managed to take on the market with the introduction of the Kindle Fire, and have slowly refined them through the Kindle HD, to now with the Kindle Fire HDX. This unit is a grand leap in performance, as well as other refinements in the platform. It offers me everything I need in the way of utility, as well as entertainment and has also improved battery life significantly. No more, no less.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: newbie
Reviews.Content: I 've had 3 Kindles including the HDFire and this is by far is the best.  Much longer battery life than the Fire, large screen so you can read one complete page before you have to flip and a little improvement in software over the HD Fire.  It is bigger to tote around but lighter so that makes it easier to use.  Overall I like it, it seems to get along with wifi even better than the other models, but still wish Kindle would let us create a folder where we can put our "read" books so they aren't always on the carousel or the book list-- just reduces the clutter a bit.  Not a lot of options for cases yet- but that will change.  Now for the apps writers to get busy.....Have not used the "Mayday" button yet but one of these lonely, long winter nights I might just tap it so I can chat with Amy:-)))

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Jack Leffe
Reviews.Content: It is like having a Computer and Pad all in one and it is fast. The display is awesome & colorful.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: broncobutch
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!  I can't say enough good things about this tablet.  My first tablet and it is a winner.  I have used other tablets from relatives and they were good.  The Kindle fire HDX 8.9 runs smooth and is very easy to navigate.  Still discovering a lot of little things I didn't know about it but it is so much fun.  I am pleased that it came preloaded with youtube.com.  I am a Amazon Prime member.  Makes a big difference with movies and books.  Anyone on the fence about buying one don't hesitate.  Get it now.  You will see for yourself how nice they are.

Reviews.Title: I love our Kindle HDX
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Joy "Think only of good thoughts, a...
Reviews.Content: My 1st Tablet and very pleased. My wife and I went back and forth between other brands and glad that we stayed with the Kindle.We are still finding out how to fly with the Kindle as it's so powerful and rich with features, a new day brings forth new excitement and discovery.

Reviews.Title: Great video and sound - But still a tablet with limited functions
Reviews.Author: Jeff is Rad
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet to replace my aging Toshiba Thrive. I knew early on that the Kindle HDX was not meant to be a full featured tablet like the Thrive and Nexus. But I was still disappointed at how much Amazon unnecessarily left out or disabled features that are common on Android tablets. The Mojito OS takes some getting used to even if you are accustomed to Android, not seeing a whole list of configuration options was a little jarring. But overall the HDX OS performed very smoothly.PROS:- Lightweight. About a third of what my Thrive tablet used to weigh.- Great display and video.- Sound was clear and crisp.- Nice case texture and screen. The back has a subtle rubber texture that makes it very easy and comfortable to hold. The screen is super smooth; it feels like you're moving your finger on an oily surface.- Painless E-Mail & Calendar Sync. I was able to connect my Google GMail account to the HDX's email client quickly and easily. However the email & calendar client are basic and limited in what they can show. For example my GMail Inbox message categories did not carry over into the HDX email client.- Speedy performance. I was able to stream Prime movies with no noticeable lag.- Connection to Amazon.com was seamless. When I took my HDX out of the box it recognized me right away and connected me to my account.- Mayday Tech Support. Really works as advertised. I was connected to a tech adviser in about 30 seconds. He was knowledgeable although he did misunderstand my initial problem and I had to interrupt to correct him.CONS:- Speech-to-Text(Voice Dictation). This is a new feature that was added in an update after my purchase. Is accurate but is noticeably slower than the voice recognition in other Android devices.- No GPS. I have read conflicting reports on whether or not the HDX has GPS or not. Either way using your HDX with GPS enabled apps is a no go.- No Haptic Feedback. It would've been nice to have a tablet that provided tactile feedback for text entry and games.- Bad photos with the Camera. My HDX took pics that were very grainy with inaccurate color. The photo options available for the HDX are also very limited. About the only things that you can change while taking a picture are the flash and panorama modes. You cannot adjust the white levels, spot metering, etc.- Limited personalization options. On my old Android tablet I like being able to organize my apps as I saw fit. Also I liked being able to change the wallpaper every now and them. There is no way to do these things with the HDX.At this point I'm torn on whether to keep my HDX or to return it. I like the idea of watching Prime Movies on a tablet even if I am not connected to the internet. However not having basic tablet functions is very frustrating. Also Amazon makes no promises that the problems will be addressed in the future. All I was told by Kindle Support was that a new update was coming soon. There was no comment about what exactly the update would contain, just that one was coming(!?!?)

Reviews.Title: Not Android Compatable
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful display, nice size, solid feel but......the Kindle HDX is Not a mainstream android Device.  I guess I missed the fact that Amazon is no longer Android when I made this purchase.  Big mistake!  These kindle devices apparently do not, will not load apps from Google play or anywhere else  BUT the Amazon store. Will not load any apps paid for in the past.  Very shut down and limited like an Apple product.  Very dissapointing for a company like Amazon to take such an obvious step BACKWARD!  Will return for refund.  Ouch!!! Purchased Galaxy Note 8.0 instead, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: return policy not good
Reviews.Author: C "cbglacier"
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle but in less than one month a 1 inch long blue line appeared about 2 inches down from the top of the screen. I called amazon they said they would send me a new one. I asked if it would be a new one and they said yes. Instead they sent me a refurbished one. I don't like refurbished electronics when I bought a new one. Now I have to decide which one to keep.

Reviews.Title: Solid, but no iPad killer.
Reviews.Author: F. Sherman
Reviews.Content: Amazon sent me this tablet free for 30 days.  I was in the market for a new tablet anyway so this seemed like a perfect opportunity to test the kindle.  I own a first generation iPad retina already and I'm looking to possibly upgrade to the Air.  Amazon puts the Kindle HDX 8.9 directly against the Air.I will start the comparison with my current retina.  When I unpacked the HDX the first thing that stands out is the weight of the machine.  It's very light and comfortable to hold.  Seams appear tight, however the plastic housing feels a bit cheap.  No doubt they used the plastic to cut weight but it does not have a quality feel and I worry about it's durability.  Next I plugged the HDX in, the plug is either purposefully angled awkwardly up (I doubt it) or it's just poorly aligned when built.  The plug works, but it is not anywhere as smooth to plug as the lightning plug on my 5s and on the new air.  It's about as easy to plug as the old Apple 30 pin on my retina.Once it was fired up and ready to roll the home screen is fairly spartan.  I decided to open my Amazon cloud account and was pleasantly surprised to see all of my stuff there and waiting.  Your Amazon account is very nicely linked to HDX.  I pulled up BB King's "Live in Japan" on both the HDX and my Retina iPad and did some side by side audio.  There is no easy way to put this, the HDX is an audio dud with the external speakers.  the iPad was capable of getting much louder, clearer and better bass response.  I tried with both on flat hard surfaces and holding in hand.  I use the external speakers when I'm working on projects around the house and want some music around so this is a fairly important feature to me.  Next came the headphones test.  Both performed equally with my Klipsch S4i headphones and my Sennheiser over ear headphones.My Amazon prime streaming was very handy on the HDX.  Easy to access and I had zero issue streaming HD quality movies.When it comes to the screen it's a bit off a toss up between the Retina and the HDX.  The HDX is capable of a slightly sharper image thanks to the higher resolution but the Retina has better colors...The HDX display just looked dull.  Whites appeared with a distinct yellow tint and nothing seemed to pop off the screen. Try as I might, I could not get it to display colors as well as my Retina.  But again, the resolution is sharper on the HDX so you need to decide whats more important to you.  To me, the colors are far more important so I will say that I prefer the Retina display, slightly, but it's still my preference.In terms of general use.  I do not, at all, like the lay out of the HDX.  Simply finding things is much more of a chore compared to the iOS layout.  This might be more to do with the fact that I'm very accustomed to iOS, but I would like to think that a well laid out tablet is something that you can pick up and it feels great right away.  I never really had a learning curve on any iOS device, it was all fairly natural.  It's hard to blame Amazon here, ease of use is something Apple has been leading the industry on for a long time, but Amazon does have a long way to go to catch Apple here.Next I did some simple web browsing.  Silk on the HDX was VERY disappointing...It's a standard web browser, but it was not smooth at all.  Load times were twice that of my Retina and scrolling up and down pages was vert stuttered.  Safari on my Retina is very smooth and very quick.  Keep in mind this is a two year old machine.Besides Safari Vs. Silk, the Retina and HDX seemed to run at about the same pace, if not slightly quicker on the Retina.  Very upsetting considering the Retina by Apple terms is a slug now.  In all reality my 5s runs circles around the HDX.When I was visiting a friend that I know picked up a brand new Air, I brought the HDX with me to do a direct head to head.  Now that it's all said and done, Amazon has zero business comparing the HDX to anything Apple is producing today...The Air just blew the HDX out of the water in nearly every aspect.  Once again, the only thing the HDX had on the Air was the resolution.  The Air loaded everything faster, was snappy and smooth as butter.The HDX is lighter, but it's also a smaller screen...IF you consider the extra screen size, the weight difference is in my opinion a non factor.  Add to that the Air keeps that solid quality Apple feel with it's metal case.  I found the Air to feel very light and nearly as tiresome to hold as my Retina.With the Air everything that has bothered me about my Retina since the latest rollout of iOS is fixed.  Mainly my Retina is now a bit laggy.  Most notably when typing.  The HDX touchscreen keyboard was hands down the worst part of it.  Almost impossible to type on in my opinion.  Laggy and a lot of mistypes compared to my iPad and even my 5s.All in all, this is not a BAD product.  But to act like it competes with the Air is just down right false.If $400 is your MAX budget, I would go with the iPad Mini Retina all day long.  If you can swing the $500 for the Air, it's no contest.My advice to Amazon, continue to fine tune this thing.  The next generation NEEDS to be MUCH faster and the HDX screen must display better colors.Maybe in the future, but it's just not there yet to sway me away from from Apple.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Amazon.com Fan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, light, thin, fast, easy to use...the new Kindle HDX seamlessly incorporated all my videos, magazines and books from my other Kindle devises within seconds of the very simple and short setup. With an Amazon.com Prime account, shopping for everything from books to space heaters and managing my content and account has never been easier. Using Bluetooth headphones and keyboards makes going wireless more than a joy---it's liberating, especially when using the treadmill. I installed the "Lastpass" application, so logging on to banking then switching to Amazon.com and other websites requires just one password entry and one tap between sites, plus added security. I wish I could buy everyone in the world a Kindle Fire with free WiFi and cellular coverage like the roads; it would singlehandedly end starvation and poverty. Imagine the possibilities of a world with free people armed with Kindle Fires, free access to roads and internet with fair trade practices in exchange for our corrupt governments and their nuclear hellfire coverage. Thank you, Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: no flash player
Reviews.Author: Lynn D. Nieto "nietold"
Reviews.Content: wish i could use it with my games on facebook but since there is no flash player that is not possible,  i still think there is another way to get around that but it is just not available

Reviews.Title: replaced my HD with HDX, perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Sarah "thebookpusher"
Reviews.Content: I love the improvements!  Moving the charger to the left of the landscape side is perfect! Controls on the back remove the chance to accidentally push them....changing the whole "e-reader" to more of a tablet....perfect.  an integrated video player that shows YouTube....perfect.  smaller size, just enough to fit better in my purse, perfect. Lighter, perfect.  Love you, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: doudou
Reviews.Content: In spite of spending 3 hrs. speaking to various Kindle Mayday "experts", I have been unable to send e-mail with my Kindle. It only receives them. Bottom line from the "experts": they "have never heard of this problem before", 2) it must be my server, wi-fi, etc... problem, not a Kindle problem, so see "your IT guys". I did. Problem not solveable: the device is unable to recognize the wifi connection. I try from home and from work. Nobody seem to be able to help, even our IT people. One of the Kindle "experts" hung up on me, one was very kind (Michel) and spent one hour trying to help, unsuccessfully. I am going to return it and get an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Amazon.com videos
Reviews.Author: L. Panchula
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed in my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  When using my Kindle to browse the Amazon.com website for products to purchase, I ran across the problem of not being able to view product videos.  After several phone calls with Amazon customer service, I was informed that the Kindle is simply not compatible with the Amazon.com website.  If the Amazon Kindle does not even work with the Amazon website, I hate to think what else it will not be compatible with.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: Simply the best ... FAST! FAST! FAST!. Smooth scrolling...amazing resolution. I went into Netflix, Showtime, HBOgo, Starz, etc. and watched some shows, to test it out, they all performed flawlessly. Crisp, sharp picture. Great depth of Dolby sound.Then tried Facebook, it opened up and worked smooth as silk while I gave it a spin.Book reading is great! Played with all the settings and let it read part of 'Enders Game' to me in several different voices, male and female. British, Australian, United States. It was fun!And I did most of it through my bluetooth headphones that took only a moment to connect. It sounded incredible. Went to the store...searched the web... played some games! Every bit of it is fun. I have already ordered 3 more for the rest of the family.I was a bit worried about the blue screen issue that the 7 inch has...but voila. Nothing! Literally nothing! Picture perfect! I love this tablet. Our family has every generation of Ipad, cept' for the the latest 'air.' We have early Kindle Fires. 4 iphone 5's. 5 laptops, and 3 desktops. And the list goes on. (Large family) And of all the devices. This is my favorite. I can get in bed, put on the headphones and play, listen, read, watch movies or surf. At one point, I had a wrestling match with my 11 year old. She wanted to try it so bad. Finally gave it to her. Had to trick her to snatch it back an hour later. She watched "YouTube" videos, with my headphones on and was laughing up a storm. This thing turned me into a kid again.Prime is great for a media junkie.INCREDIBLE TABLET! Thanks AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Mayday and Prime Downloads a disappointment
Reviews.Author: Patrick Baude "pbaude"
Reviews.Content: The ability to download prime instant videos was the deciding factor in my purchase.  When the HDX arrived, I successfully downloaded 6 1080p movies.  One week later when I tried to download another movie all my previous downloads were gone form the "Videos" module.  The kicker is that they still showed as taking up 40+ GB of space.  So no movies and no space for more movies.  This was the start of my experience with Amazon support for the HDX using "Mayday".After confirming my issue to the Mayday rep, she quickly said that she needed to transfer me to another department.  It would've been nice if this stayed within the kindle mayday world, but alas my support call was moved to the phone.  I guess mayday is really only for technology neophytes and not for resolving any real problems.  When I was talking to the third different department to which I was transfered my cellphone call was dropped.  I decided to move this inquiry to the email world.  The HDX support asked me to download some log files (by typing ;dm in the home search) to my laptop for emailing.  Alas the zipped logs exceeded the 6MB amazon email limit so I had to unzip and repackage the logs to be sent in 5 separate emails.  I stopped trying to solve the issue and returned the kindle when I found out that the email that Amazon told me to reply to was a donotreply address.I went with the kindle because I was willing to accept the kindle-ized version of android as long as everything worked smoothly and I coudl enjoy the amazon content.  But unfortunately the opportunity cost of the time I've spent in the first week re-downloading videos and working with Amazon support negated any price savings I may have enjoyed versus an iPad.I'm now 3 days into enjoying my Retina iPad mini and am much much happier.  I may be poorer in terms of $, but I am richer in terms of time that I can use to earn more $ or enjoy the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Boxed up and returned the very same day I received it.
Reviews.Author: 2Wanna
Reviews.Content: Every function I tried on the HDX 8.9" resulted in me rebooting it several times to get them to work.  It wouldn't download a magazine nor any of my books from the cloud.  It took TWO reboots to finally get those to download/open. It timed out and then gave me the "web page not found" error message several times when trying to open Facebook...reboot again.  Five minutes into a video it froze and then lost connection with WiFi (I have U-Verse.)  All this trial and testing was done along side my year old Fire HD 8.9" which performed flawlessly and always has.  After forty-five minutes of rebooting and frustration, I requested a return.

Reviews.Title: poor battery life...problem solved
Reviews.Author: Leonard L. Zaikowski
Reviews.Content: I really want to love this tablet but I'm having an issue with battery discharging when the unit is off. I fully charge it and don't use it for 2 or 3 days then pick it up to use it and the battery is completely dead. This has happened twice in the past week. I have the Amazon cover that shuts it off when you close it and I make sure no apps are running. Am I doing something to cause this?Found out you have to press and HOLD the power button down to fully shut off. I now love this tablet! 5 star.

Reviews.Title: This Tablet is amazing
Reviews.Author: D. S.
Reviews.Content: I believe this Kindle Fire 8.9" Tablet is the most advanced tablet on the market.I own three other tablets  including an Acer 8" quad core 4.2 Android and thistablet leaves them all in the dust. The 8 mp camera with auto focus is excellentand I used the flash when depositing a check or scanning a barcode. This is thelightest and highest resolution on the market and I am very happy with it. I findit a pleasure to watch TV and movies with no buffering and stunning graphics.This tablet is a great price and a joy to use. My only recommendation forimprovement is move the volume and on button to the previous location sothey are easier to access.. PS the mayday live assist is first rate to solve problems.Please continue to  stay ahead the competition in the tablet field..

Reviews.Title: Not multi functional...great as a reader, not so much for web browsing!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Our household has been very satisfied users of the Kindle products for a number of years, primarily as a reader (original edition and a Fire, purchased in 2012). I purchased the HDX as a gift for my husband who wanted to use it as a browser as well as a reader. Unfortunately, using it as a browser is often a frustrating experience in that it is slow and can be counted on to crash at least once with every session.After two returns, and being shipped two replacements resulting in the same issue, we've given up and reconciled to the fact that we'll live with it!Note: though an inconvenience, our experience with customer service was extremely cordial and professional!

Reviews.Title: mixed feelinga
Reviews.Author: LL
Reviews.Content: I loved the resolution, the lightness and the battery life, but it's not really a work thing. for the price, I can't justify it for my needs, tho.  Oh, the screen seems to flicker a lot and I couldn't figure out how o stop it. there seems to be connectivity issues with older routers. was up and down a lot at home but not at the office. why give 3 stars then (I returned it)? because i think for someone using it for Prime or games or Facebook would be happier with it and there's probably a way to control the screen flickering but I didn't have the patience to figure it out. Also, someones else's state of the art wireless system probably won't have connection issues. can't helped but be impressed with the design. I don't think throwing in a stand/cover for the price would kill Amazon, tho. Let's not start nickle and diming us on everything, folks...

Reviews.Title: One happy girl!
Reviews.Author: MiaGirl
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle 8.9 HDX, I upgraded from the 7" Fire HD, because I wanted a larger screen, faster processor and a rear facing camera and this one has it all. I was hoping to get a little more battery power from the HDX, but I haven't noticed much of an improvement from the 7" fire. I still have to charge it every other day depending on what I do with it, but I do use my kindle everyday!  The HDX is very user friendly and the colors are beautiful. I've taken several pictures and videos and I'm definitely satisfied with the quality. I can really tell the difference with the quicker processor, my emails load up much faster as well as web pages when I'm browsing.  I'm traveling to Europe soon and I needed access to my email and the internet, rather than carrying my laptop with me, my Kindle will be really convenient, I'll have my books, music and documents in this 8.9" powerhouse. As far as my 7" fire, it is still going strong, but now I let my grandkids use it and so far its holding up to the challenge.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jan Blackwell
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 and use it a lot. I'm not into a lot of the stuff it is capable of doing, mostly reading, playing games and checking email. My disappointments with it are: 1. Big issue, I really wanted the availability of having the camera. Afterspending so much on this opted for inexpensive case. Case is designed to be used with the camera but software issue blocks the camera view. Thought I could just take it out of the case and use it but view is still blocked by message to move it up in case. Apparently only solution is to buy their expensive case. Really Amazon?? 2. Because of glare it is difficult to impossible to use if you are outside on sunny day. 3. My $30. e-cigarette charger has light  that lets me know if it is charging or done charging. After all the charging issues with first generation Kindle Fire I don't understand why they would have gotten rid of the charging light. Not good design decision to me. In view of these issues the four star rating seems too high but I do like it too much to use only three stars because I do consider it above average.

Reviews.Title: Didn't think...
Reviews.Author: Linda Hall "A truck driver"
Reviews.Content: I didn't think this would be any better than my old (well not really old only a little over a year) Kindle Fire. But, the 1.9" makes a big difference. Plus the internet and the videos and games download much faster.I love being able to fling things onto my TV (I also have the Fire TV which is excellent). I can even fling my books onto the TV (though I was told by a rep that you can't). Since I make bread and like to try new recipes this is excellent. I can put the recipe on my TV and see it from the kitchen (set your Kindle to stay on for an hr or so).It also makes some of the games  more fun. Mostly the hidden object games, the action games can't be used on TV unless it's strictly for others to watch you play. But, the hidden objects are easier to spot on the TV.Also,  I would keep the special offers, I've found many good deals with the special offers and they don't pop-up. They're only there when you open the Kindle and you have the option to ignore it or open it to check it out.I can't find one bad issue with this HDX. Even the battery life is very good. I left it on with the internet all day yesterday (well, for about 12hrs anyway) and finally plugged it in with 29% still left.Thanks Amazon for another great product!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband and we both love it, so easy to use and the picture and sound is amazing, so clear. I am so happy I chose this one, the front and back facing cameras not only take beautiful pictures but Skype works perfectly.  We also tried the Mayday button with a question, this is a great feature.  We totally recommend this tablet to everyone any age you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: worrisome decision, glad I bought
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ya-ya"
Reviews.Content: I have owned 2 versions of iPods, got fed up with them because I replaced 2 screens.  I even had the last iPad in an otter box case!  I am 67 and travel often and wanted something not so expensive thinking that might be a reason I've damaged the ipads.  Since I'm a Prime member this seemed to be a good choice. I also owned a Nexus 7 and a Galaxy Tab 7".  I like this Kindle more than the Nexus and Galaxy. It's faster. I like the bookmark screens. The screen is sharp and the audio without ear buds is excellent.  I sold my iPad, gave the Nexus to my son for an extra gadget for his family.  I have an eight year old son who loves the full size iPads, but he never complained one bit about using the Kindle when he visits me.  I bought the warranty after reading reviews about service.  I'm not a big electronics warranty person, but after broken screen disasters in the past, thought it might be wise.  I haven't tried the May Day feature. I have done fairly well with their experimental streaming video on links like CNN.  I like to use instructional videos on you tube and the app I'm using doesn't always show the picture.  I guess when I get annoyed enough with that, I will try Mayday.  I use the Kindle Fire HDX for email, surfing, video and once in awhile listen to my Audible books with it.  My grandson loves YouTube Lego videos, movies, tv shows and games.  The Apple app universe is huge, but I have found more apps than expected or would use. It is a very good size.  I bought an inexpensive case for it,  I think I would prefer the origami design.  This may not be the best place to mention this, but oh how I would love for Amazon to come up with a recommend video program like Netflix does.  I think trying to find something to watch in movies or tv is a little tedious unless you know exactly what you want to watch.  Love the Netflix rec that says based on your rating of .... we recommend this.....last, I know there was some brouhaha over Prime membership prices, but I still think it's has offered very good value for me.

Reviews.Title: Best in class Amazon tablet!
Reviews.Author: American Shopper
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is the best tablet i have ever owned! The screen is very crisp and beautiful, processing power is comparable to the iPad (maybe even better), and the battery life is superb. Many reviews I've seen complain about the limited apps in the Amazon Appstore, but so far, their appstore has what I need. The speakerss on this machine are by far the best of any tablet. If you're the kind of person who is worried about the tabket you should get, i would highlt recommend the Kindle  Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Shallow Learning Curve, Superb for Reading, Viewing, Listening
Reviews.Author: D. L. Keur "write novels as E. J. Ruek"
Reviews.Content: I'm Smartphone and Mac phobic. I hate icon driven. So why in the world would I even consider a Kindle when the command line is where I live on computers.  Because I'm tired of hauling dead tree books around.  And, after years and months of wavering, I went ahead and decided to try one--the biggest one...because I don't like "little" and I don't like plain.  Well, the shock of the icon driven system lasted about a day.  And, yes, while I'm still learning all the ins and outs, it's very user intuitive. Plus there's that magic instant live help if you're near a wifi connection. (And they really do answer instantly, too.)  i have no complaints, whatsoever...except for one small thing: It's addictive to read on a Kindle, and, if, like me, you're already addicted to reading, you'll find yourself even more so, because reading on a Kindle HDX 8.9" is pure heaven. Think you read fast now? You'll come close to doubling your reading speed, if you're anything like me.  No page turning, no stopping when you need a sip of your favorite beverage (get an otter box for it, too, btw). In short, this machine revolutionizes reading.  My one OTHER suggestion: get a couple of those packages of styluses for it. It will make it easier for you to navigate around while learning the 'how-to's.  Also helpful for the really tiny links that sometimes can frustrate you surfing with the onboard web browser.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Ted E. Richardson
Reviews.Content: It is amazing.  My daughter even offered to trade here Ipad3 for it.  The rear camera is great.  The colors are bright and true.  It is light and the battery life is good.

Reviews.Title: Fantasitc Plaything
Reviews.Author: Vicki Hopkins, Author "Vicki Hopkins, Author"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle Fire 7" last year on Amazon.  Since it was my first Kindle, I thought it was pretty good.  My only complaint was the weight.  Holding it while reading a book made my wrist tired.  My 29 year old son tried it one day, and I let him take it home to use on a loan.  That was six months ago, and it's obvious it's not coming back.  So today I went to a retailer who had one in stock on sale (hate to wait for things to arrive) and purchased this instead.  I'm in love.The unit is much larger, lighter, better sound quality, awesome picture, and great camera.  As an author, it's great to look at my own books and even hear my own audio books on the unit.  It lets me know what my readers and listeners are seeing and hearing to use for my own quality checks. Besides that, I can do so much more for my own entertainment.  Everything works fine on the unit.  Easy setup.  I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  The price was in my budget and a more affordable guilty pleasure than other expensive pads on the market.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and I love it!
Reviews.Author: Lil' Bob
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is great - easy to set up and easy to use!  I'm sure there is a lot more for me to explore!

Reviews.Title: Better Than iPad Air for Speed and Amazon Instant Videos
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Researched this purchase for a month.  Very pleased with the 8.9 HDX.  I use an iPhone 5 daily and own a first generation Kindle Fire.  We have several iPads in the family and I even bought an iPad Air only to return it when my Amazon Instant Videos would not download to completion (I'm a big Breaking Bad fan).  The Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX is amazingly fast and smooth.  Better than the iPad for speed and just as easy to use if you have any experience with the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet to use for your personal presentations
Reviews.Author: donald fournier
Reviews.Content: I am a certified Microsoft System Administrator.  However, I have always stayed away from tablets as I work with workstations and servers.  I was finally drawn into the tablet market when I saw how well the Kindle fire 8.9 HDX could play videos.  My main concern was the cost of having to pay for 4G option to be able to have access to the internet all of the time.  I opted out of the 4G option and went with the 64 GB for the following reason.  I can sideload ( another way of saying copying files from your pc to the kindle via the usb cable) many of my MP4 movies and photo charts and mp3 music files ot my Kindle.  I can even make a folder on the kindle when connected to my pc using the pc to do the work.  So, you can have personal folders for putting all of you material into an organized matter.  You can also turn off "auto update to personal cloud" so you do not go over your personal 5GB of space free.  The battery stays charged longer when wifi is off (known as airplane mode which you can set on your kindle).  I had to order the 64GB directly from amazon as Best Buy does not carry the 64GB option.  I have placed a lot of charts, books and personal videos and personal music files on the kindle and still have only used up around 5 GB of space with around 49 GB still available.  The 64 GB model actually uses around 5+ GB of system memory so you end up with around 58 GB available for storage space when you first turn it on.The back camera takes a very high quality movie file in mp4 format.  It played back upside down at first on my pc but I used premiere to flip the video and exported it to a straight up video.If you take a picture with the back camera you will get a very high quality photo.  The catch is that if you email the pic to yourself it will be of a size around `1600 x 1200 picture.  If you hook it up to your computer via the usb cable then you will find it under a Dicom folder looking for camera then look through the subfolders and the file will be located.  copying from the dicom folder to your pc will end up giving you the maximum size of the photo without being sized down.  So it is extremely high resoulution at 300 dpi.Also if you want to turn off the auto to personal cloud  you will go through the settings device storage personal movies settings and buried that deep is the option to turn off auto load to personal cloud.  recommend you turn that feature off.The speakers give you great audio for personal use while you may need to use an external speaker for a louder sound.  In mentioning this the Bluetooth external speakers around 49 and below do not play any louder than the speakers you all ready have so you do not need to purchase a blue tooth speaker unless of course you get a high end one with high gain at 100 dollars or more.I would recommend this (64GB) to anyone who has lots of mp4 videos and charts and pictures and music to sideloadI played netflix on my kindle via the wifi in Books a Million and it played great.  No dropouts.  Make sure you go through the kindle store to get the right version.  Tech support is only a button away and they really are professional in what they do.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect ...
Reviews.Author: Gerard T. Lee "gtkyl"
Reviews.Content: The HDX is a great tablet except for one thing ... it keeps dropping it's WiFi connection .... this is a PITA when watching films, browsing the net or checking email ... If they can come up with a fix, I would give it 5 stars ...

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Grammar Police "Moms"
Reviews.Content: If you are on the fence about what to buy, I'm going to be pretty simple here.  I have owned several ipods, an Ipad2 10" and an iPad mini.  I still have the ipod and the mini, and when my Ipad2 went on the fritz, I was debating whether to replace it with an iPad Air or a Kindle Fire.  I have always believed the ipad was superior and the Cadillac of all devices.  But the cost!  And I hate iTunes.  Apple does their updates and they never seem to care if their customers are having problems or not.  If something goes wrong with your device, you had better have an extended contract, because they won't fix anything.So, tired of Apple and iTunes, and all the hassles that come with it, I decided to look into Kindle.  A friend gave me the Kindle Fire HDX with 64g as a gift.  My first impression was OMG at the beautiful screen.  It is so clean and clear and just gorgeous!  A little smaller than a 10", but come on.  Not really noticeable.  Watching movies and everything else is just plain great.I was very surprised that a lot of my Apple products automatically synced with Kindle with no hassle whatsoever.  I also have a Energi charger for my iPad that also works with the Kindle!  I was amazed.Mayday, where you have access to 24/7 help, is awesome.  Where else can you get service like this?  Try and even find a live person on Apple to help you.  I dare you.  I was having trouble with setting up music and they walked me right through it.I found it difficult to figure out setting up music and movies.  I was used to iTunes and I just couldn't figure out the Cloud Player.  I find it sort of clumsy, but after I figured it out it was no problem.  Amazon books and music are cheaper than iTunes.  I have an Apple TV and now Amazon plays on there as well.I read that getting 64 gig wasn't necessary.  Well, music and movies and photos take up most of your space.  Even though Amazon doesn't allow you to have a ton of videos on your device, we always end up using more space than we think we will.  On my Apple devices, I have my music and audiobooks on my ipod.  I put my photos on my computer.  The rest goes on my Ipad.  With Kindle, I can pretty much put it all on one device, if I choose to do so.Amazon Prime does not have the movie and tv selection for free that Netflix or Hulu have.  They need to work on that.  But the free shipping more than offsets this little glitch.I also love Amazon because you can get help.  If something goes wrong or you get a product you don't like, they make it right.  You get your money back and they help you and they appear to listen.  So I am a big Amazon fan and always will be.  In this day and age, customer service is important to me.Lots of neat little features.  Too many to go into here.I do not like the email, the way it is set up.  Confusing and just pretty much hate it.  I get emails much quicker on my ipad. Don't like the keypad.  It's a little different in that the space bar is small and there's a period next to it, so I keep hitting the period.  Little stuff I don't like, and it doesn't matter in the scheme of things.I don't have an Ipad Air, but from what I've read, it's probably awesome.  But I got 64 gig of memory and an awesome tablet with wonderful features for $439 on a Kindle.  Try buying an Ipad Air with 64 gig and see what it costs you.I think it all comes down to what do you want from your tablet, which will probably last you about three years.  If it doesn't go bad, technology will move forward and you will want to replace it.  I think Amazon hit a home run with their Kindle HDX.  I have had it a couple weeks and I absolutely love it.  Oh, and by the way.  I did not get the Origami case for it.  I bought a bundle called DigitalsOnDemand and it gave me the most awesome leather case, sleeve cover, stylus pen, USB cable, chargers, etc...  a steal for the money.  The screen protector was a piece of junk, so I got the Moshi iVisor XT.And best of all.  Try it and if you don't like it, send it back.  You can't go wrong.  You can't do that with Apple.

Reviews.Title: Even a seventy year old can use it.
Reviews.Author: NC. movie man
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say I know nothing about computers only how to turn them on and off but I love to read I saw the 7"HD and wanted it. My son fell in love with it so I ordered the 9.8 HD because of the bigger screen loved that so I gave my son the 7" the 9.8 HDX came out I wanted it for the mayday. The others I had no trouble getting the wi-fi working but this one no matter what I did it would not connect so I hit the mayday a very nice young girl came on I told her my problem. She asked if she could take over my screen I told her by all means so bless her heart she did everything she could to connect it for me, she told me I had to get a number from my IP what ever that is so I call the telephone service they gave it to me, well I hit the mayday button again, this time an older man came on I told him what the little girl did and about IP he said I didn't need that he took over in 10 seconds it was up and running. Have not used it again but it's so nice to know it's there for old farts like me. I say jump on it, get the protection plan if you are butter fingers like me you will need it. There is no hue around the screen like I have read, I can't see for the life of me why some on here has been giving it one star. The picture is so clear the sound I am hard of hearing had to use head phones with my others I can hear this one very well. I can take pictures of my grand kids and e-mail them to my computer after my son showed me how. Word of advice don't buy a cheap cover the back camera will not slide up to take them it's a pain taking it out of the cover. Oh yes one more thing I didn't know anything about the point credits on my prime card I came across them by chance at the time I made up my mind to go for it, between the points and the one time fifty off  I only paid one hundred and twenty five dollars so check for them. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I've used, and I've used many.
Reviews.Author: J. Peck "j peck"
Reviews.Content: Amazon has really hit the mark with this one. The Kindle Fire HDX is awesome.The Fire OS is very nice. Most apps are available now in the Amazon store. The screen in amazing. Best of all is the size. It is a little smaller than an iPad, but I think this is a plus. It is only slightly smaller, but is lighter and easier to grip. It can easily be wielded with just one hand when reading. Also, the built-in tethering works perfectly.I also love the tight integration with Amazon's media. I have always preferred to buy my music, books, and movies from Amazon not Apple because I can use them on Apple, Android, Fire, Linux, the MP3 player built-in to my car or just about anything else. With Apple's store you are locked in to their products.I have owned an Kindle Fire, iPad 1, iPad 3, iPad Mini 1, iPad Air, and this tablet. The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 has definitely been my favorite. The iPad Air doesn't really compare.I highly recommend this tablet. You will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: ON FIRE
Reviews.Author: chef please
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice,I've only owned the Fire 8.9 for a month but it's all that it's cranked up to be and more. Incredible graphics and the Silk browser is so quick and smooth I can't  believe it.Battery life is very good ,I will add an external keyboard though it's a bit tedious typing onscreen but that's just me .I would ,and have recommended this to many friends and family.Yes a bit smaller than iPad Air but better graphics and much lighter and less expensive so the choice was easy Kindle Fire 8.9

Reviews.Title: Overpriced book reader
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Long shot from Apple or Samsung devices.Carousel on the main screen is annoying and can't be deactivated, according to tech support.Bookmarks from Chrome, couldn't be shortcut to home screen.Couldn't find the AmEx app in the appstore...I was waiting for delivery for 2+ weeks...It goes back after two hours of ownership

Reviews.Title: Incredible Device
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Jeff Bezos keeps hitting home runs left and right. The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is no exception.Pros:1. Super light. I meant his when I write it; we have a Kindle Fire HD 7" and this feels lighter than that (and this is the larger version). I've held the iPads (including the mini) and this device trumps them all.2. Way to go with the new power and volume buttons. They are recessed so you can feel them without looking on the side of the device.3. Power USB Placement: It's on the left side of the device now (the HD had it on the bottom which was awkward when you wanted to lay in bed and charge while watching Prime Instant Video.4. Speakers: Excellent placement (top of the device as opposed to the bottom). Sound quality is shockingly amazing for such a thin device.5. Cameras: Front and rear facing and the picture looks amazing.Haven't tried out much else yet but love it so far.Cons:1. They took away the micro USB port for HDMI. You have to use a mirror cast feature. Not sure yet if my TV is compatible. I'll check on that.Overall:Don't waste your time with an iPad or Samsung product. Amazon takes care of you in the tablet arena and gives you everything you need with this premium product at an incredible, rock-bottom price.

Reviews.Title: Christmas present to myself!
Reviews.Author: volebal1
Reviews.Content: I love it!  I got it to replace my computer on the go.  I wanted to start reading more books and the size of this makes it very easy.  The games are good to kill time.  I like the fact I can take pics of the grandkids and keep them on my kindle to show my friends.  I can check the weather, my bank accounts, read the paper and check my calender for events. AND with the Time Warner app I can watch another tv channel while the hubby watches his football games!  This will be my go to for travel, ball games, dr apts, and entertainment for the grandkids.  Easy to operate and fun to use - even for a senior!

Reviews.Title: Best Electronic Device of the Year
Reviews.Author: Jeff Casey
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is my favorite device. This is the best reader for e-books AND audio books AND you can watch all of your Amazon digital videos on it. You can also load all of your mp3 music on to it. The only thing that I would add might be a small memory card reader for expanding your available memory beyond 64GB. It is compatible with just about all of the Android apps. However, I would recommend one of the new mobile security apps early on to prevent you from downloading garbage... Personal favorites are Lookout Security and Bitdefender. If I could only have one device on a desert island with electricity (and, er, internet) this would definitely be it~!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Riley
Reviews.Content: I only got to have a 30 day trial of this beautiful device. It truly is worth every penny. It' just so light and the screen is so sharp almost hurts your eyes.(in a good way) It definitely is better than an Ipad  Air for just price alone but all it's features too. I work with electronics as a job and we carry Apple products and only thing it has on this device is a bit bigger. Other than that this device is faster smoother and sharper. Plus it has very good sound for such a thin light machine. I would definitely pick this up if your looking at something under $400 you won't be disappointed. Plus like everyone probably has seen on T.V. it ahs the mayday feature which shows how good Amazon is with there customer service. So quit reading this and BUY NOW!

Reviews.Title: Nothing Compares
Reviews.Author: Tanya D. Williams
Reviews.Content: The latest kindle...WOW! Love, Love, Love this device. The weight, screen size, graphics and options are exceptional. It definitely competes with the other tablets in the market. Excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Amazon definitely got this right!!!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Thurier "soothsayer"
Reviews.Content: Very impressive piece of technology!!! I have been a huge Amazon user for years now. I have owned every type of Kindle since the very first e-reader came on the scene. I was debating between the HDX and the Google Nexus 7. I have to believe I made the right choice since I get all my books and movies and music with my Amazon Prime membership .This tablet is very smooth and fast in every task I put it through. Nice and thin and lightweight. This was my Christmas present to myself and I am very, very happy with this purchase. I will be taking it over to my brother's house on Christmas and compare it to the iPad mini he just bought for his wife. I think he might be regretting his decision.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE KINDLE FIRE HDX
Reviews.Author: T. vanburen
Reviews.Content: My entire Family loves it! we have so many apps and cnnot put it down! I take it on the go as well. i read text, I check emails, play candy crush and watch Scandal on ABC.com!

Reviews.Title: My Third Kindle! Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 64GB
Reviews.Author: Prolific Reader
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd kindle and by far the best! The graphics are amazing. The processor is fast and it is lightweight. Sorry IPad you are a distant 2nd.

Reviews.Title: BEST GADGET I EVER BOUGHT
Reviews.Author: Linda Black
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle!!  It has gone beyond my expectations.  I am not at all technically gifted and I am doing amazingly well with it.  I have used the help button and it is magical.  Each time they have given me what I needed to master my problem or answer my question.I can now email, facebook,  take photos and even print from my Kindle.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Ron Maron
Reviews.Content: Ready to use as soon as opened. Already charged. Amazon has scads of apps to download from their App store. Many of them are free. The MADAY function is super. A technician comes on in just a few seconds and solves every question or problem with ease. The tech sees your tablet screen but not you. You however see the tech in real time. I highly advise purchasing the 8.9 HDX as I did.

Reviews.Title: This 8.9 inch Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Albert Cantin
Reviews.Content: This is just so great to have! It can do so much and all the free apps really help also, so I would surely say this item was worth every having and even the on-line help comes in very handy! Anyone considering this, I would say; Do it!!

Reviews.Title: Happy with my new Kindle HDX 8.9!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Lavender
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle HDX 8.9, Wi-Fi, 64 GB!  I have the first generation 7" model which was very nice, but this larger size is really great.  My eyesight is not too good, so the larger size allows me to increase the font size and still be able to see a generous portion of the "page".  I loaded several PDF  documents I needed for a continuing education class to the HDX and took it to class.  I used the HDX all day long (without WIFI on) and still had 56% charge left.  I also downloaded a few free game apps which worked well.  VERY happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Fanatic
Reviews.Author: Deborah Camp "Author of more than 50 novels. ...
Reviews.Content: I am a Kindle Fire fanatic! Love, love, love it. I have the smaller version, as well. This tablet size is great for watching movies, surfing the Web, etc. I use it every day for hours and hours. Charges quickly. I took it out of the box and started using it right the next minute. Couldn't be easier. I plan to give them as gifts this Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX Review 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Simply Love it!  I have the original Kindle Fire in 7" form and I am very pleased with it.  My wife gifted me the 8.9" Kindle Fire HDX and I am amazed at the improvements.  The tablet is an amazing device, very responsive, beautiful screen, does everything that I would use a tablet for.  It is light weight, ease to use in any orientation, all of my books and applications transferred over without an issue.  I have friends that use the Apple device, but the Kindle experience is much richer in my personal opinion.  Keep up the good work Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Glad I got it
Reviews.Author: Craig in IL "EasyDailyLiving"
Reviews.Content: Great for books, music, videos, email, games - just carrying around with you.  Wish I had started on this a year ago.  New version is lighter to carry than the year old version my wife uses.  Many other improvements, too.  I'm using this much more than I thought I would.

Reviews.Title: Just what you'd exspect it to be
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Its  very nice. I've used it daily since I received it and the battery life has been very good. It's easy to use and does everything  I hoped it'd do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle 64gb w/o special offers (Fun Tablet)
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: For starters, my kindle is 64gig, w/o special offers. Since this is my first tablet, I don't have much experience to compare to. I will say this, it is an impressive machine, since I have gotten my tablet I have used my computer less and I enjoy reading more. I meant to give it a 4.5 stars, unfortunately I can't. My reason is because it is a great tablet, but the graphics isn't that great when watching youtube videos. Of course, I go directly to the website instead of the app so that could be why. Overall, I am very happy with my kindle and hope that you like it as well!

Reviews.Title: Extreme improvement over last generation
Reviews.Author: Archaegeo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic device. Got Mirracast working with LG 55L.A.6900.  So far it is easily replacing my 3rd generation iPad. Little to say that other reviews.haven't covered.

Reviews.Title: More than just a Reader: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Donald C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I have owned other readers, but this is so much more than just a reader.  The book-reading function includes a full-blown dictionary and lots of other functions I haven't discovered.  But when you want more than a reader, you have a web browser, a very high resolution camera facing away from the user and a 1.9 megapixel facing the user, a calendar/appointment book that interfaces with the contacts list, and hundreds if not thousands of downloadable apps.  I am extremely happy with my new Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Title: Panasonic app does not work with the kindle
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle so I could load pictures from my lumix zs30 to the kindle using wifi.  When I tried the app it said it is outdated.  Now the people at kindle support want me to load pictures to my computer from the camera then load them from the computer to the kindle.  When I travel I will have to take a computer in addition to the camera and kindle.  No one at kindle support or amazon has said that they will add a usable app to solve this problem.  Seems to me this would be the correct response to solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Sean C. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from my old original Kindle Fire, and I am so happy. The screen is nice and large. Picture is clear, and has mass amount of space for my books, pics, and documents. I am very pleased with this version Kindle has produced.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle is quite possibly my soulmate
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Fosterocalypse"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my Kindle. It is the best electronic device in my arsenal. Highly recommended. For anyone who loves awesome stuff.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Barbara Reid-James
Reviews.Content: I chose it especially for the rear facing camera, and I enjoy using it.I would recommend it to anyone i know who wishes to buy a tablet.My only problem is that my geographical location restricts some apps.

Reviews.Title: Love my HDX
Reviews.Author: J Allison
Reviews.Content: I love my HDX.  The main selling point for me was the May day feature. I've used it several times and the people were so helpful and polite.The response time was  very fast and my problem solved quickly.

Reviews.Title: Blazing fast
Reviews.Author: Jim White
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire. It is blazing fast and very lightweight. However there is one drawback that I have found. On some of my  books especially the Bibles there is no Table of contents.

Reviews.Title: Love the fire
Reviews.Author: Indy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful love love love it!!! I haven't even begun to do all it's capable of. The best tablet on the market!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: William S.
Reviews.Content: The picture resolution is outstanding.  Coupled with the slimness, weight, and excellent relocation of the power and volume controls makes the HDX a must!

Reviews.Title: Good price point, terrible introduction.
Reviews.Author: Don Moriarty "Space and Time are what we seek...
Reviews.Content: Why get Amazon Kindle Fire? Price, need a tablet, want a tablet, buy most your products off Amazon.When I first got it, I was in need of downloading a file manager or else I was stuck wondering how to access them. My head was hurting at trying to find apps I might actually use. My head still hurts while attempting to find games I would like that are both paid and free. No Google Play store, so Amazon forces you to buy their products. There are ways around this, but it has been a few weeks so far and I have not even found many apk files I am happy with. I swear Amazon would sell nearly 10 times more tablets if their tablet were already rooted, and I would be willing to pay an extra $50 to Amazon for this feature.Samsung Galaxy phones are rooted and I buy things from Google Play because there is more, but I also use Amazon shopping app for when I am not at home. If Amazon were to contract for Google Play on their tablet, it would solve at least 80% of my problems with this thing and likely make Amazon a ton of money off Google's apps through the tablet. Of course, some CEOs of Amazon might not consider this, or there might have been contract negotiations but they were not in agreement. Could just be that CEOs are not the brightest in the company.I love Amazon, I love most of the ways they handle their business. I just do not like some of their marketing schemes, or most of them. With talks of Amazon now in favor of closing off online tax loopholes they once used to gain their wealth as a company, to an increased yearly subscription fee which is marketed mainly for their video services, to the best of the low-priced tablets forcing you to spend money on them even though they can make more money by catering to the consumer's wants.I bought my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Wi-Fi 64GB for a decent price. I think the current price is steep, and would suggest buying for substantially less until they can either "root" it or add Google Play so that you feel the need to use it more than you think you might. I was thinking of nearly selling it back to someone just because of the headache. Do yourself a favor though, and take a look at it carefully if you know someone who has this.The screen is bright, you can get many apps still off the web built in to the software, and overall am satisfied with this machine only because I know my way around roadblocks with computers and phones. If you like to read, watch movies, browse the web this is a great tablet. If you like to play games or are not much knowledgeable about current tech, I suggest against buying this. Oh, and it only seems to use keyboard controls, not gamepad controls. Look up Red Samurai gaming controller, it costs only $10 at GameStop and works well with the tablet.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"!
Reviews.Author: Carol P. Alvarez
Reviews.Content: It does everything I wanted it to do and more.  Besides using it as a reader, I use it for e-mail. With the Office Pro app, I do Excel spreadsheets and Word documents.  The camera is great, and the pictures are easy to download to the PC or send via email or share on social media.  Surfing the net is a breeze.  The Kindle store has loads of great apps--many of them for free.  I am very pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend the Kindle Fire HDX to others.

Reviews.Title: Reading and Viewing In The Lap Of Luxury
Reviews.Author: JPP Smorenburg
Reviews.Content: I bought the HDX 8.9 as an International Customer located in Holland. This means no Mp3 store, and no video streaming for me. This could be a showstopper when contemplating the HDX in my situation. I've had every Eink Kindle except the Kindle 1 and the big DX. I've sold my old models when upgrading to the newer device. My most recent Eink Kindle was the Paperwhite 1 3G. When upgrading, and passing on to my son the Kindle Fire HD 1, 7" to get the HDX 7, the latter gave me such a good reading experience (in addition to the much improved browser, speed and form factor) that I sold my Paperwhite 1 3G without upgrading to the Paperwhite 2, and switched fully to reading on KF HDX LCD. I had to get used to it, but I read several hours per day, without complaint and the only gripe I have is the lesser battery time compared to an Eink Kindle, although the lighting has speeded up the drainage in the Paperwhite.  In practice, the battery life is quite sufficient to last a full day of reading and surfing the web. When comparing the HDX 7 with larger tablets in shops, I found the bigger screens very comfy for reading and surfing. That made me buy the HDX 8.9. I thought for a long time about buying the ipad mini retina, but the HDX 8.9 had a bigger screen for less (32gb version) and the awesome integrated Amazon experience and after sales. Plus, the Kindle reader software  is the best, more optioned out, on a Kindle device. The geographical mp3 and video restrictions I took for granted, because I mostly read and surf. Plus, Spotify takes care of the music streaming for now.I'm very pleased with the HDX 8.9, it is as fast as the HDX7, and the screen is even better, in particular the more even gray reading background. The text sharpness and colors are incredible. The overall size is not too big, though the HDX 7 disappears in you hands and flips into a coat pocket and has the edge in that respect. The 8.9 weight is low, even with the wonderful origami cover. The camera is good, and the speakers are the same good quality as the HDX 7. The 8.9" screen really opens up an Ebook page, and web surfing is luxurious compared to a smaller screen. Compared to the newest iPad models screens, the HDX 8.9 does not disappoint, to say the least. To hold, the HDX 8.9 is more comfy than the Air, lighter and less slippery, and even, in my opinion than the iPad mini. On a personal note, I always liked the Fire Home screen better than the somewhat "paler" iPad home screen with the smaller app icons. The slightly compromised handling compared to the HDX 7 is a compromise that comes with the bigger screen. For me, it is worth the trade off.  Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Super MayDay Service
Reviews.Author: JoAnn C. Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I have had my HDX 8.9 for several weeks and had no trouble with it at all. The screen is beautiful and the unit is light and speedy.  Today I had my first occasion to call MayDay for help getting an app installed.  I was delighted with how quickly Daniel came on line to assist me.  He was very personable and professional and took care of getting the correct version of the app downloaded and installed in just a few minutes.  Without his help I might have been stewing over the problem for a long time and possibly firing off bad reviews of the app or the kindle.  I urge fellow kindle purchasers to use this wonderful free service when they are having difficulties rather than getting their "knickers in a twist" and giving negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HDX 8.9 - What a great little tablet!
Reviews.Author: MonaVie User
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 7'' HDX for my wife about 3 weeks ago and couldn't leave it alone, so I decided to grab one of these babies when I saw the great payment deal on Amazon.  Also, it works great on TMOBILE.  Just pop out the AT&T; nano sim and pop in the TMOBILE sim and you get 4G LTE, no issues what so ever.The video playback is super quick, works great with Netflix, HuluPlus, my PLEX server and a bunch of other streaming services including Amazon Video and my Amazon Cloud files. I added the Belkin QODE bluetooth keyboard case and it makes a great travelling baby laptop.

Reviews.Title: amazon - you got me good
Reviews.Author: dp77dp77
Reviews.Content: the apps store is so poor that it makes this pad useless to me.  the store does not include many of the apps that you are used to using.  none of the google apps are on the store.  there are knock-off apps all over the place.  don't be fooled and get some unsafe app.  i don't think amazon monitors or regulates their app store.  i believe the amazon app store is the step brother to actual android store.  of the limited official authenticate apps on the amazon store, some of them have poor formatting (fonts and bar and window sizing).  i can assume this is because the publishers don't care about the amazon version of the app and don't bother with fixes.you are better off sticking to a pad that uses itunes or android.

Reviews.Title: Okay, this little hdx is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Michael Tuccillo
Reviews.Content: All the short comings of the Kindle HD are  no longer on this HDX.  Improvements that I didn't even think about are offered in my touch pad.  For example, I was just reading an article on a web site and they have this read button that is offered by the tablet to reformat the web screen for a much improved reading format!  There's just so many little goodies packed into this amazing little tablet.  The big items such as an improved viewing of quality of movies and pictures is so amazing.  The operating system works so seamlessly.  I have bought many different Android phones and tablets over the years and always compared them to my Mac tablet as wannabes.  Not this HDX though.  It is everything and more than my Mac tablet.

Reviews.Title: So much better than my I-pad Air!
Reviews.Author: Crissty H Hopkins
Reviews.Content: The android market wins this time. I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. I love the Android Market! No more wasting money on apps that should be free. And the best part is that this unit has two sided cameras. It is very fast and I am very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: An amazing piece for the technologically challenged !
Reviews.Author: JAMES HOYLE
Reviews.Content: After much research and review, I chose this tablet as a Christmas gift for my wife.  It is comparable to the Apple i Pad Air, but a whopping 35% less expensive, saving you a lot of money.  Forget that the Kindle is Amazon-centric (the i Pad is Apple-centric anyway), this device has a beautifully crisp and bright display as well as exceptional speed.  But most importantly, it has the 'Mayday' button which has prevented much anxiety between my wife and I over tutoring of the tablet.  I don't own a Kindle myself, so when my wife asks for help, I am usually at a loss for the answer because I have no Kindle experience.  Enter the relationship saving (just kidding) 'Mayday' button.  If I am unable to help answer a question, 'Mayday' is initiated and I stay close by to help explain the question/need/issue.  The wait for assistance has always been very short.  The 'Mayday' folks have been amazing with their product and accessory knowledge, as well as their patience and guidance.  The fact that the 'Mayday' people are able to see the user's screen and circle items that the user is seeing on-screen and may need to access or be aware of during the tutoring ('Mayday')session is an amazing boon for those who are non-verbal learners.  I would recommend this device to anyone who is unfamiliar with technology, doesn't own a cell phone and is still using an alpha-numeric pager,any non-linear thinker, anyone who is dyslexic or unable to grasp 'state of the art' gadgets.  It certainly makes technology much more accessible and usable for those people.  Thanks Amazon - great work !

Reviews.Title: Great tool, more than I expected.
Reviews.Author: madeleine g dickie
Reviews.Content: Works great right out of the box.  More than I expected, no issues with email or internet.  Quick charge.  Only con so far is they have removed the mini-hdmi slot.  I used this to connect to my TV to watch downloaded movies.

Reviews.Title: Great HW experience, poor web browser experience
Reviews.Author: why2jjj "why2jjj"
Reviews.Content: For as great as the HW is, Amazon.com could have saved some money on the HW and invested in better software, mainly the Silk browser, and greatly improve the overall experience of this product.The silk browser is the worst browser I have ever used.  It's slow, it can screw up page rendering by placing graphics over text, it's inflexible to font size adjustment (a BIG use-case Amazon should know better being a book company), and it can make font blurry upon the end of scrolling a page (and won't sharpen the font unless you tap on the screen a couple times).  I've tested tens of websites using the Kindle HDX 8.9" via the Silk browser vs laptops (Macbook and Win7, a fair comparison because many tablets are replacing laptop purchases) from Facebook to worldbank.org to programming sites to wikipedia to government sites (ex. cdc.gov) to search sites (like Yahoo...this case it doesn't seem to work as well holding the tablet in landscape mode) investment sites (ex. The Motley Fool). They all get screwed up somehow, some-way, even if the screw-up is just crazy-slow page loading (probably partly due to how Silk traffic gets redirected to Amazon servers). This is a big problem for a device like this because a core competency of tablets are web browsing.Thus, I give the product a low ranking and I will most likely return it to Amazon because Amazon does not provide web browser alternatives on their app store (which I don't blame them, but then the company better deliver on an awesome web browser solution, which the company certainly does not).  It pains me to say this, because I really like the potential of this device, I just cannot get around justifying an almost $400 tablet with crummy web browsing that you really have no work-around solution (like try an alternative web browser).If you want to read further, below is a specific example of one site and example issues I run into and then an example on how Silk could be better.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Goto http://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/computersciencetheory/sortcomp.html (yes, I work in computers).Problem 1- tiny font. Even setting the Kindle OS settings to "big font" will not fix the font. Yes, I can zoom in w/my fingers but then I have to always side swipe and scroll the screen to read the text.  I want Silk to be able to increase the font settings and re-render the page so the font fits within the viewable window.  This is something Chrome, Firefox, and Safari all do well via "hold Ctrl key, then hit + +" key sequence on laptops.Problem 2.- Silk does give you the option of hitting "reading view" button, IF the button it actually appears for that page (does not always happen). For this page it does.  Sometimes the "reading view" button does provide a good reading experience. however, not in this case.  Two problems occur: 1. Scrolling the window and when it stops there is nothing but blurred, almost unreadable font.  Tapping the screen a few times seems to correct it.  2. It makes the main text font SMALLER and cannot be adjusted at all (no zoom and the 'increase font key' only adjusts the title of the page).How I would like Silk to work?  A good start is exactly mimicking the wikipedia.org phone app you can download to the HDX device for every web site Silk encounters (not just wikipedia web pages).  For a phone app, the wikipedia does a pretty good job re-rendering wikipedia pages and sticking graphics in the right place when you increase the font size on the HDX (I set it to 300% font size and it's plenty easy on the eyes).  It will be easy to see the shortcomings of Silk browser by just surfing and clicking wikipedia pages (and comparing it to either the wikipedia app running on the HDX or a web browser on a laptop).

Reviews.Title: Cajun
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Ladousier "Cajun"
Reviews.Content: I am totally pleased with my new HDX Fire, Wi-Fi, 64 GB. This device does all that I want it to do. I have be loyal to the Kindle product structure since its beginning. This is my 4th Kindle and am extremely satisfied with the versatility that is brought to the table with this product. I had been considering the iPad Air until this new HDX Fire 8.9 came out. Now I would not even consider the Apple product. I am a PC user from way-back and will not switch thanks to this android device.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Gizmo
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT.  ENOUGH SAID!!!  Wish I had purchased this besides having purchased Kindle White a few months prior.  This does everything Kindle White does but SO MUCH MORE.  I use my laptop for hardcore work but I find myself using the Kindle Fire for literally EVERYTHING else even filming and broadcasting my YouTubeChannel.

Reviews.Title: Best device for existing Kindle user
Reviews.Author: ca
Reviews.Content: So the  real question for existing Kindle fire users.... Are other devices better? .  I have the note 2,  rooted my old Kindle be a nexus,  and my wife has an ipad.  The answer is no.  I don't need a big phone  (without the phone). The ipad is not better . My wife admits that my screen is beautiful.  I am an amateur photographer with a professional monitor.  This Kindle is ideal for viewing quality images. ( I don't take photos with the  hdx) .  I have all my music on Amazon and I'm already  a prime member.  So this device fits in perfectly.  The downside is that the native browser does not support all videos. Not a big loss.  I sideloaded dolphin  and found that I rarely use it.  In my opinion this is the best device for an existing Kindle user.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: leo249
Reviews.Content: The good - very light, battery lasts a long time, you can play games, read magazines, watch movies, check your email, browse the internet and there are tons of applications for it.  The screen is very responsive to touch.  It has a beautiful screen; the colors are very vibrant.  I had no issues whatsoever connecting to my wireless network.  My wife uses it a lot for facebook.  She can just sit on the couch and doesn't have to sit in front of a computer anymore!  She takes it in the kitchen when cooking to follow the recipes she has pulled up on the screen.The bad - it has horrible glare.  If you want to use this product outside is just not going to work.Overall I thing this is a great tablet.  This is the first tablet we own so I have nothing to compare it to but I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Who needs a NOOK
Reviews.Author: mark earls
Reviews.Content: I received a discount offer prior to the holidays on electronics. Had not shopped Amazon in a while so decided to take a look - been seeing the commercials for the Fire HDX - we already had a Nook color - after reading the specs and reviews decided to purchase one. Could not be happier - the wife does not even use her Nook anymore she loved the Fire so much that I have ordered a 2nd one for her - great product - fast delivery - great customer care - could not be happier - heartily recommend if you are looking for a tablet/reader/net device

Reviews.Title: Very nice Kindle
Reviews.Author: Connie R. Johnston "RaznDazln"
Reviews.Content: Being a bit of a tech geek, I can't help but get the latest version of the Kindle.  I've had several including the 8.9" HD.  I'm still getting used to the new 8.9 HDX and, overall, find it to have more great features for how I use Kindle.  The sound is so much better, the camera for pictures and videos on the backside is really handy and the response time is much better.  The screen quality is outstanding!  I'm using the Dolphin browser and it works smoothly with the Kindle.  I use my Kindle a lot rather than using a computer. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it, but....
Reviews.Author: Mel "health nut"
Reviews.Content: ...like some other reviews, 2 weeks after receiving it, it crashed. I am covered for receiving a new device, but wondering about the longevity/quality...

Reviews.Title: Love it - with additions
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas.  As a reader and multimedia tablet I don't think I could have done better.Added a Bluetooth keyboard and mouse, and it serves quite well as a notepad as well.  With the keyboard and mouse it works really well to remote to my regular computer.  The one issue I have is that the google play store is not available (hint).  I have a couple of paid apps that are not available in the amazon store, and I don't want to pay twice for them.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: 5 out of 5! I got the HDX 8.9 because I wanted a little larger screen. I Love it! This is my new "baby." I am a college student and this makes a handy carry around. I don't need my lap top for all my classes and the Kindle is great for accessing info from the internet at a moments notice. I can't afford a smartphone on my tight budget but this Kindle lets me check my e-mail when I need to between classes. I have only begun to touch the surface of what this Kindle can do and I am entranced with it.

Reviews.Title: Just plain awesome!
Reviews.Author: buzznut
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these devices, 32GB, wi-fi only. My wife has her first device ever and she is loving it. We are not gamers or movie watchers and Amazon's app store has been sufficient for what we want.
