Some of the software features are fantastic, especially the Mayday help feature which works great and has been helpful multiple times already. The tight integration with Amazon services is a huge plus for us, since we use so many Amazon services.Unfortunately, we also use many Google services, and this device doesn't speak Google very well. Specifically, we use Google Apps for Business for almost everything online, but this Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 just doesn't allow us to use those services the same way a regular Android device would.Also, one of the things I love about Android devices is the customization, and most of that is right out the window on Fire OS. No custom launchers, no custom lock screens, no home screen widgets... and this highlights the biggest drawback for me: the Amazon App Store is just too limited. For example, I really dislike the stock Kindle Fire keyboard. It auto-corrects at the most annoying times, it doesn't learn very well, and it's generally just not very efficient. I'm used to the 3rd party SwiftKey keyboard. But that's not available for Fire OS at all. Neither is ANY 3rd party keyboard app. Most of the stuff available in the Amazon App Store is a bunch of games which are intended to separate me from my money rather than provide a useful function. Since I'm not much of a gamer, that's not useful for me. There are SOME productivity and utility apps available in the store, but very few. Nothing even close to what I can do with my Samsung Galaxy Note II.And that really sums up this device in a nutshell... there's a whole lot of things you can't do with it. About the only thing this tablet can do that an Android tablet can't do is play Amazon Videos. This device is mostly meant as an easy way to access Amazon content, not as a serious productivity tool. I was looking more for a companion device to my Galaxy Note II, but instead I ended up with something closer to an entertainment gateway.I'm still trying to decide if I want to send it back. It's not seeing much use right now. It just kinda sits on our living room table for a few days, until someone needs to use it and realizes that the battery has died. Then we plug it in to recharge it and the process starts all over again.I did try to shoehorn some Google-specific apps in there, like Gmail and Chrome. There are guides on the web that explain how to do so without voiding your warranty. But the Kindle Fire just isn't designed to handle some of the functions these apps require, and there are frequent error messages that crop up and need to be dismissed, even when you're not actively using those Google apps. It's not a very pleasant experience. We'd be better off sticking to what this device was meant for, which is consuming Amazon content.edit: it really is a gorgeous device, and that bears repeating. The screen is stunningly beautiful, the sound is clear and loud, I love every aspect of the hardware.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed - "Upgrades" don't measure up
Reviews.Author: CL-10
Reviews.Content: As a big Kindle lover, I pre-ordered my HDX as soon as they were shown on Amazon.  Two things that I really don't like:1 - There is no connection for a mini HDMI cable like there is on the original kindle Fire - the ability to easily play content on your TV is gone - and that stinks!2 - The pitch that you would be able to download Prime movies instead of only watching them in a streaming format was a bait & switch ... very few of the Prime movies are available for download.  Of the ones I checked - about 20% are downloadable - and that stinks too!I have had minor glitch with the browser crapping out.  All in all - I would have just kept my original Fire, and saved my $500 as the upgrades touted for the HDX don't measure up in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Not All I Hoped For...Lacks Versatility
Reviews.Author: Minnie I.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this version of the Kindle Fire for two reasons. First to get more storage than my original Kindle Fire and second to achieve more versatility. I definitely have more storage and can put more content on it. But the promised versatility is disappointing. The only way to "output" content from your Kindle to a TV is through Miracast. So, if you have an older TV, it HAS to have an HDMI port and you have to have purchase an adapter, which is another $60-$90.(I bought the Netgear version.)The mirroring works pretty well if you have nice, high def media. So a high def movie I created looks great; HBO-to-go streaming, not so much. The movies I downloaded from Amazon were not "highest" quality, so on larger TVs, these movies get pixelated pretty fast. Consequently, when traveling and I want to hook up this device to another television to substitute for local content, I will make sure to download the highest resolution. Good thing I got maximum storage. I'll also need to plan for the longer downloads of highest quality content before traveling and will make sure I purchase the high def versions from Amazon.I also purchased the Bluetooth keyboard. The keyboard is kind of cheap feeling--lightweight plastic. That isn't necessarily bad,I like the lightness. But the size is just a bit bigger than the device so hauling it around requires some slop in a case. I have the origami case right now, and it's okay, but I'm not sure the designers of the device, case, and keyboard talked to each other to create transport efficiencies.Also, I've found that the device is sensitive and often "quits" from an application or a book with the slightest movement. (This might be a result of the buttons on the back of the device and their interaction with the origami case.) This also is disappointing. The screen, size, and weight are outstanding. The sound isn't all it's amped up to  be but it's still pretty good for a small device. If it weren't for the disappointing versatility, I would say this provides beautiful high-def quality and a pretty good choice. But for larger display use, this device is limited. As a mobile device for doing work, it's not bad, but still doesn't offer the versatility of a Surface, for example. In the end, the amount I spent on this device and all the accoutrements could have purchased a high-end Windows 8 or similar tablet and provided me greater flexibility.

Reviews.Title: Love My New 8.9 HDX, 64GB Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kate Fredericks "Kate"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Kindle and by far the best yet. I am not well versed in all things technology, I just like what I like. The very first thing I noticed when lifting it out of its box, was how light it is. I truly had no idea it was going to be lighter than all of the previous versions, but the difference is, I can actually hold this tablet comfortably with one hand while typing with the other. I could not do this for more than a minute or so with my other 4 Kindles. Plus, the sleekness of the style helps, too. It is not boxy like the other versions, but curves under which surprisingly gives my holding hand a much better grip.The clarity of picture was the second thing I noticed when I fired up my knew super-duper Kindle. Everything was so sharp, it almost hurt my eyes! The third thing I noticed was the speed. Compared to my last 8.9 HD, this thing flies! The fourth thing I noticed is FINALLY a new and far better key board. I type about 80 WPM on my laptop. I know I don't type that fast on these built in keyboards, but this is the first time I have felt like I am typing on a solid, well-built tablet keyboard. It has kept up with everything I type (something the old 8.9 HD never did), and has a far better auto correct function. The auto correct function is also much faster learning words it doesn't recognize, something that drove me crazy on the old 8.9 HD.As for the battery, I am in the process of testing it now. I gave it a full charge yesterday and took it off around 5:00 p.m. I did some Twitter and Facebook, accidentally found the camera which I immediately took several pictures and movies in very low light. I have a black Lab and a black cat. In low light I literally can't get a decent picture of either of them and if I use flash, all I get are eyes (in low light). This thing took amazing pictures AND movies of both of my animals which when played back were the clearest I have been able to get them.As for the Mayday button, having owned so many Kindles, I chuckled when I read it was a feature. But when I could NOT figure out how to move some important apps from my 8.9 HD to this new HDX, I decided to give it a try. Within a minute, I was talking to a very nice young lady, who took control of my Kindle, showed me how to move what could be moved and along with me learning that my favorite weather app was not yet compatible with this one. RATS! So, I suppose you all who know electronics well might not need that button, but THANK YOU AMAZON, for the likes of me who need a helping hand now and again.I actually brought home and tried the new Windows 8 tablet and it SERIOUSLY could not even remotely compare with the old 8.9 HD let alone my new HDX which is way way better than that Surface (in my opinion). Not going to go into details here, let's just say I already know the Kindle, and after using this new HDX, I am staying with the Kindle. To get back to the battery. I have been on and off all day, and am finishing this review with 75% of the battery left! That is jaw dropping for me. I had to stay plugged into my old Kindles because I was lucky to get 3 hours doing the same thing. It has now been 27 hours and this Kindle has only used 25% of its battery?I wholeheartedly recommend this 8.9 HDX, 64 GB Kindle. It is easy to learn, easy to use, and this recent updated Kindle is like going from a small economy car to a loaded Cadillac.

Reviews.Title: Key Feature removed! (edited)
Reviews.Author: William W. Perry "RocknJo"
Reviews.Content: There are many pluses to the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. All are plugged well on the web page for this product.There is one MAJOR negative that is not mention on the web page. The HDMI feature that got me to buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 has been removed from the HDX version.  I travel 90% of the time. Most hotels now have TV's with an HDMI connection. If TV is bad, I plug in the HDMI from my Kindle to watch a High def movie. I am not able to do that with the "improved" Kindle HDX. HDX has new technology which will allow wireless connection to your TV if you have the new technology in your TV. This was a deal breaker for me. I had to return my unit because it no longer does what I bought it for.Edit Dec. 23rd, 2013.  If one of the Amazon techs had told me about the miramax adaptor, then I would not have returned my HDX.  The adaptor should correct my issue of needing the HDMI. I have changed my review to 4 stars, not 5 because of the lack of good information from the 2 techs I spoke with.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disapointing
Reviews.Author: Chris Fogel
Reviews.Content: I eagerly looked forward to getting this device, but once I received it, its limitations became exceedingly clear.  In its efforts to control content and apps on the device, Amazon has limited and changed the android operating system so that only a limited number of apps work on the device.  Anything requiring JAVA will not run.  This means things like your banking app, your softphone, your cloud access apps, your local newspaper  and many other apps simply are not compatible with the device.  You can't even access the android store or Google play on the device.Yeh, the screen is nice and it runs what it runs quickly, but for my purposes it is useless.  How disappointing.

Reviews.Title: My experience in verse
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: I thought that I should never seeA thing as wonderful as K3.Until my Fire arrived intactWith all the color Kindle lackedNetflix was grand and music rushedTo fill the K3 void, but--The carousel displayed too much.The screen was small, the apps were iffy--But iPad 2 fixed that, in a jiffy!We were one, my 2 and I.Apps and games and 'net did fly!But as life goes, things changed and turned,And the iPad 2, for which I'd yearned,Now graces life for an unworthy other."Boo-hoo," I mourned, then went online,For an iPad 3, and thus recovered.When that one arrived at my door.A marvel of pixels, and cameras, and more,"Oh, wow!" I said, and forgot Mr. 2,There was so much surfing, and working, and playing to do.Mr. 3 was all that plus a big bag of chips.And I vowed with my heart and affirmative lips,Three was the last tablet for me--no more flips!Heh.Fickle am I, and easily swayed,A sucker for sales and payments delayed.My HDX arrived last week.So far, it's exactly the tablet I seek.Clarity, sound, and apps galore,So much speed, and worlds to explore,Poor Mr. 3 seems puny at best.Perhaps it's time to give him a rest.HDX, I adore you. I can't be wrong.At least till the next one comes along...

Reviews.Title: Not WiFi Compatible for Streaming Video except on homenetworks/Matchbooks selection inadequate
Reviews.Author: B. Davis
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire was the best that Amazon could offer but it came up short for me. As a Wifi only device it was necessary to wait almost 8 hours to download only a 28 minute episode of Alpha House of any quality at a local coffee shop.I have joined the many people disconnecting from the high priced Internet Providers. A true Wifi device needs to offer a means of downloading or streaming away from your home.The download speed was limited to 3 kbps which is typical of limited public Wifi sites. Streaming was impossible on the Kindle while my Lenovo Twist had no trouble at all streaming Netflix. Also, after purchasing hundreds of paperback and hardbound books only 6 books were available from the Matchbook Kindle special pricing(2.99, 1.99, 99) on books I already own. So sad. So the majority of any books I already own would need to be repurchased at a substantial cost to me and I found a ridiculously poor way to market the device that cost me $369.00 with tax. For the money I found the latest Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 to be a waste of money to be an expensive e-reader in today's technology revolution and with new products being released everyday.A good product needs to have added value to justify the cost of converting from hard texts to Kindle/e-books.It could not come close to competing with streaming I have on my 3 year old DroidX or my 1 year old Lenovo Twist. Battery life was nice and substantially close to stated length of operation which was the best feature, if I could have enjoyed using it.After repeated attempts to get more value or any way of improving the performance through customer service I have returned it in hopes that some day Amazon will understand their customer's true needs in the technology field.

Reviews.Title: Eats through my data plan like thanksgiving dinner.
Reviews.Author: S. INGRAM
Reviews.Content: We love our new kindle fire hdx. Everything is very impressive and works great!The only reason I am not giving it five stars is that the thing just chews through data.If I don't turn off the wi-fi or put it in airplane mode it stays connected. (even when the tablet is turned off)We live in the country and use a hot spot with 5 gigs of data per month and have never went over our limit.We have a desktop, 2-laptops, a smart tv, and an original kindle fire. and nothing chews through data like this thing.We don't stream movies or anything, but sometimes this thing will go through 2-3 gigs of data a day with minimal use.Any tips for us? We want to love our new hdx, but may not be able to afford to.

Reviews.Title: New HDX - You need to take a look at the reviews for this! OMG it's nice.
Reviews.Author: Edward A Holgate
Reviews.Content: First impressions.... OMG! I'll write more later after I get to know it but this is one beautiful device. So light and thin it makes it a joy to use while reading and surfing in bed.

Reviews.Title: Can I get my money back?
Reviews.Author: Richard Lundy
Reviews.Content: There is no port to connect an HDMI cable to to stream programming to a tv. But the worst thing about it is the failure of the web browser to maintain an internet connection. I constantly get an error message saying that the browser can't connect to the website server of almost any site even though the device shows in the wireless settings tab that it has a good wi-fi connection with a strong signal. My Kindle HD doesn't seem to have this issue as I use it to stream programming to the tv frequently.

Reviews.Title: This Is The Best So Far
Reviews.Author: Taul Tales "Taul Tales"
Reviews.Content: Right now I wouldn't trade my Kindle Fire HDX for anything. It does more than my smaller Kindle and of course it's nice to have a larger screen than the 7 inch. I don't like the tablets or other devices but I love the Kindles and for me, it is worth every penny. Especially with an Amazon Prime yearly subscription. Almost every place I go to I take my Kindle with me to watch a movie or to read. Restaurants, doctor visits, in the car (if I'm the passenger) on trips, etc.

Reviews.Title: worst wifi ever
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This machine can not pick up my network from 3 feet away from the router without constantly resetting it. So much for advertising new and improved double strength wifi. I have called tech support but they blame my internet provider, My telephone can pick up my wireless network through 18 inches of masonry,

Reviews.Title: Kindle stop working
Reviews.Author: Marion L. Pittman
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire a little less than six months. Now it won't turn on when I press the on button. Later it turns on but only shows the the "KINDLE FIRE" logo. then it goes black as if it turned off. All this without the button being pushed.I checked the warranty and it's supposed to be covered for one year but the info is so confusing that I have no idea how to contact Amazon for the warranty. So I rate it as minus one star.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I received this as a birthday gift last week, this has been a huge disappointment as I have two other kindles and have not had problems with them. Apps will not update. I have to restart to be able to use for a short time, then apps stop updating again.  It is a huge hassle to now have to return this item and attempt to get my money back.  Very sad with the quality. Wondering if this was a refurbished item that they sold as new??

Reviews.Title: Some Glaring Problems
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Wendy D. Rakus
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire has many excellent qualities which have been listed in many reviews, and for the most part I agree with them.  But there are a few major problems that make me wish I had bought a different tablet.You can't use Google Play.  There are several apps that I would like to have, but they aren't available in the Kindle app store.  If you want to have access to as many apps as possible, get a Nook.No Flash Player!  Androids are no longer supported.  Want to do an online crossword puzzle?  Sorry.  They require Flash.  Want to watch a friend's video on Facebook?  Can't do that either.  There is a way to work around this and install Flash, but it doesn't work on every Kindle Fire.  Unfortunately, mine is one that it doesn't work on.  If you plan to use your tablet for a lot of things that require Flash, get an iPad.The majority of the game apps that I have can't be used without having internet access.  These aren't online games but puzzle games that are installed on my Kindle Fire.  I can't use them in airplane mode, and I can't use them while traveling.  I have to assume that this was done on purpose to force customers to buy the more expensive 4G version.  Neither the Nook nor iPad has this problem.My husband has a Nook, both of my kids have iPads, and I have a Kindle Fire.  Out of the three, the Kindle Fire is my least favorite.

Reviews.Title: Mayday a key feature.
Reviews.Author: avis webb
Reviews.Content: The May day feature is A1 and for a klutz like me is a real boon. I really enjoy using the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Mom Loves it!
Reviews.Author: iCastle
Reviews.Content: Sent this as a Mother's day gift to my mom. No complaints, easy setup.  Although she already owns  7" version, but had express interest in the newest 9" HDX because of the side by side iPad Retina vs. Kindle HDX comparisons she had seen in Amazon's commercial. Plus, I was offered 6 months payments, no interest or fees. I really like it for the "Mayday" button. My mother calls me when she's unable to work any electronic devices. So this is a huge help for her and myself as well.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Sherion Beck
Reviews.Content: Best money I ever spent..  Perfect for what I use it for.  Research, emails.games.reading books. Even great for taking pictures. Lightweight.  Online quick tech support. Wondered if 16g would be enough for me but so far ..no problem.have had it for about 9 months now. Would not trade for any other on the market.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Exceeds my Expectations
Reviews.Author: Starchylace
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" four months ago, and have been successfully using it every day.  I am extremely pleased with my decision.  After extensive research, comparing the KF HDX 8.9" to the competition tablets, I decided to purchase the KF HDX 8.9" since it met my needs the most.  I’m already an active member of the Amazon family in that I’m a Prime member, I currently own the Kindle Keyboard, and have MP3 music stored in my Amazon Cloud, so it was almost a given decision for me.  What was important for me was to have a large amount of storage and have the 4G LTE option tablet, therefore I purchased the 64G with the AT&T; 4G LTE built into my tablet.I have the ease of adding the 4G LTE prepaid monthly plan onto my tablet when traveling, and have enough storage to store several downloaded movies for airline flight viewing, along with many games, books, and music already stored onto my device.  The 4G LTE service works great when out of Wi-Fi range, and with being an Amazon Prime member I’m able to download certain T.V. shows and movies.  It took me about 1 hour to download a 50 minute T.V. episode in HD 1080 quality (I kept the tablet plugged in and charging while performing the download).  I had no problems with downloading and viewing the episodes was just fine.The built in Amazon environment is perfect, and easy to navigate on the tablet.  Watching videos via my Prime Membership is flawless and the HD quality and surround sound is excellent, better than expected.  Having the Mayday button is convenient, and I’ve successfully utilized this feature about six times.My battery consumption averages about 10 – 13 hours between charges, depending on my use.  If my use is higher on playing games and streaming/downloading, then I get about 10 hours.  If I use the tablet for reading more, than it’s about 12 – 14 hours.  I perform the functions that help prolong the battery usage, in that I keep my tablet in airplane mode so that it is not constantly pinging for Wi-Fi behind the scenes, manually power off my tablet when not in use, lowered the brightness as much as possible, set my device to go into the power save mode after 1 minute of non-use, and to check for emails every hour.Even though the KF tablet is lightweight, I do wish that the screen size for the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" was larger (about the IPad Air size) since the actual screen size when powered on is less than 8.9 due to the blank black edging.  Also, not having flash player support is a negative.  I haven’t tried out the mirror-flick to my T.V. since my T.V. doesn’t have this feature.  I wish the HDX tablet also had the HDMI outlet built in like the older models.For the most part, I feel the Kindle Fire available apps meet my needs, however, there’s a few apps that I wish were available, from companies like SW Airlines, etc… I do like that the HDX 8.9"  has GPS built in (you can turn this feature off), so I’m able to utilize the Mapquest app perfectly.  Also, the silk browser seems to respond quickly and I like being able to access multiple tabs at the same time.For night reading, since the white backlit background is too bright for me even when the brightness is reduced to zero, I like the choice of background colors in which I change mine to light brown that is much easier on the eyes for nighttime reading.  However, for daylight reading I still prefer my old Kindle Keyboard in which I can read in direct sunlight with no glare.  I’m unable to do that with the tablet, but I’ve heard changing the reading background to black with white text helps (haven’t tried that yet).In summary, the 64 G Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" with built in 4G LTE service meets/exceed my needs.  I’m very pleased with my purchased.  I hope this review helps :)

Reviews.Title: It's the bomb!
Reviews.Author: Kim Kelley
Reviews.Content: I just bought the new Kindle after having my Fire HD for about a year and a half.  This unit is so much lighter and I like the way we can now group our icons on the main screen.  Connectivity is great and the screen is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: LOVE our KINDLES
Reviews.Author: frugalcrafter
Reviews.Content: We were big Apple fans but not since we got the Kindle Fire HD.  As soon as we saw the HDX come out we KNEW we had to have it too.  Both of us have our own and we love love love them.  The new resolutions and wider screen makes so much difference and it truly IS a big change from the others.Being prime members even before trying the Kindles, it just fits for us to make the switch from Apple to full Amazon. The movies on this is awesome and we like the light weight.  It flicks over through our PS4 to the TV with ease.LOVE THEM!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not as reliable as my HD
Reviews.Author: DogLover
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was expecting too much from my new HDX because I was so happy from the beginning with my HD but half the time the HDX will not load my new emails and more than half the time it will not open Pandora and the GPS is not trustworthy.  I have received some help from customer service (very pleasant and patient, although, there was some follow-up promised, after my last contact was unable to resolve my issues, that never occurred).  I find that if I turn the HDX off and then back on some of the problems resolve themselves but it is very irritating and time-consuming and not what I had come to expect from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: "Buggy" and kind of disappointing
Reviews.Author: Colonel D
Reviews.Content: I’ve was pleasantly surprised when I bought the first generation KF for it’s portability and ability to perform a multitude of functions simply at a decent price.  I was not motivated to try Gen 2 but when they rolled out the new HDX I decided to take the plunge and upgrade to the KF HDX 8.9 w/32 GB, w/o special offers.Overall this device has had it’s issues.  If you read most of the 1 and 2 star reviews these are largely people who apparently didn’t do much if any research prior to purchase and now discover the limitations with access to certain features they expected, dedicated “appholes” who still can’t believe the device doesn’t support Flash or some esoteric game or another, and then die-hard Apple devotees who will never be satisfied unless there’s a Macintosh apple logo on it and the few who missed the part about no mini- HDMI port.I went in eyes wide open and yet there are many things that could be better.  Much touted battery life isn’t so great from what I’ve observed and agree with many the charging port appears to be very fragile.  I bought the overpriced Origami vinyl case and dislike the floppy foldable cover and the fact it takes your featherweight KF and turns it into a boat anchor (using it will tone up your forearms pronto).  It also does quirky things like after the last OS update a number of the very few apps I have installed lost their color icons only to be replaced by a grayed out box…they still work but why are they like this (on the cloud too).  The new KF will pester you constantly to enable “Location Based Services” and there’s no way to make it stop.  You’ll be watching a video and the dialog box will pop up interrupting the show, once I say “no” , that should suffice.  Prior to the OS update often when turning on Wi-Fi the device would re-boot itself, many folks have complained of this but for now with mine it seems to have stopped.  Finally, even though I paid the $15 to spare myself the “special offers” advertising you still get little “suggestions” on the carousel with whatever book, song, app, etc. that’s showing which I could live without.So far, none of these are show stoppers but they do give me pause and given some of the fine Android based tablets available as an alternative I may try one of those next go-round.  Bottom-line; do your research and know what you’re buying

Reviews.Title: internet connection issues
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: when this device loses it's internet connection you just have to turn it off and walk away, then come back in a few hours.

Reviews.Title: Would you purchase a Kindle Fire HD knowing it cannot play FLASH (Youtube)?
Reviews.Author: Bill Spindler
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is excellent for most uses. I think Amazon should be very up front with the population of potential buyers and tell them that Adobe no longer supports mobile devices. Although it is an excellent device I would not have purchased it knowing this.

Reviews.Title: Way too many gremlins to be acceptable
Reviews.Author: Toad37
Reviews.Content: Freezes up too often. Drops wi-fi signal WAY too often. Has a nice screen but with with all the bugs it just makes the overall usage unenjoyable. I have it for about 6 weeks but I will be taking it back to Best Buy this week and beg them for store credit so I can get a more reliable product.Tip for those recording a video- for whatever reason, you have to hold the Kindle upside down to make sure home-videos transfered to other devices can be viewed right-side up.

Reviews.Title: Oh Fire, I loved you so much, why are you so fragile?
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: This was my first personal tablet.  I got it for Christmas in 2013 and I LOVED it.  It was beautiful and crisp and smooth, with a surprisingly good camera as well.  I had (still have) a Kindle reading device and hubby has a first-gen Fire 7" that is still going strong, but this one was MINE.I put a Skinomi screen protector and an IVSO KeyBook Bluetooth Keyboard Case on for protection before I even started to use it.  And yet, only 2 months later here we are, me with a bricked Kindle Fire after a slide off the couch of less than 3 feet.  One small crack and the screen no longer responds when you try to click things.  I've seen people with smartphones with the screen literally shattered and it still responds.  Perhaps I should have bought the extended protection, but I've never ruined a device quite this thoroughly before.  A new one won't be in the budget for a year at least.It's extremely disappointing.  So beautiful, so breakable.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Cherie H McKelvey
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet. I own an iPad, an iPad mini,Fire he and the new8.9 hex. Hdx is the best I have owned. Wi-Fi reception is far superior to any iPad product. Processor is fast and stable. Apple's app store has more but Amazon has everything I'll ever need. Screen is superior as well. Unless you are Apple groupie, this is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: good not great
Reviews.Author: jabezmurphy
Reviews.Content: I have to reset the WiFi every time at home. I can go to the salon and not do anything to get t connected. Doesnt make sense to me..

Reviews.Title: Love my Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: LonnieK
Reviews.Content: This is my third and favorite tablet I "started" with an entry level Ziio that still works. I moved to an Acer A200 and the screen started behaving erratically. I am very familiar with most of the top tablets on the market through both personal and professional interaction. My tablet use 80/90% entertainment the Fire HDX is lightning quick, has gr8 applications and games and terrific support. The video and audio performance is fantastic; I love the feature to download videos to the tablet for "offline" viewing. Battery life is amazing; I have used it for days to watch movies listen to music read  etc.before having to charge it. I am extremely happy with my purchase; I forgot to note that it is "feather light", so holding the HDX for extended periods won't feel like a workout.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet. Needs more apps
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Great screen and features. Better than most tablets out there. My only problem is that the applications selection are still limited. Particularly when it comes to google.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Dragonlyn "Stephen & Marilyn"
Reviews.Content: It's only been out of the package for three hours but I haven't been able to put it down. So easy to use and lightweight. More later.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Joyce Harring
Reviews.Content: I love this new Kindle.What I miss is the exterior charging light (green & amber), also the settings iconfor ease in screen brightness control. In certain light the screen is too bright for readingcomfortably.My original Kindle Fire had these features, so I guess I just got used to them.

Reviews.Title: Love the size and how fast it is
Reviews.Author: Kdskandles
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX and I'm just getting started learning all the ins and out but so far I am really enjoying using it.  It is very fast and I love the size.  Now I wished I would have waited because now they have a $30 off coupon.  I received mine on Tuesday and now on Thursday the discount.  Oh well the device is still great.  I would recommend to everyone.  One thing that I wish is that if you have multiple deices that you could chose which device you want your books on and it wouldn't show up on the other ones unless you downloaded the content.  I have a 5 year old grandson who has his own Fire that is attached to my account so all of my books, etc show up on his.  At this age it doesn't really matter but as he is starting to read it will matter since some of the books are not appropriate for kids.  I know that you can activate free time but if it is off and he can get to other content that is not good.  Just a suggestion since when I order it asks for which Kindle but that doesn't matter because it ends up on all of them.

Reviews.Title: This is my Fifth Kindle and I love it!
Reviews.Author: Whovian
Reviews.Content: Yes, my FIFTH. My first was a kindle keyboard which my daughter now enjoys. The second was the first gen Fire. Third was the second gen fire. Fourth is my kindle paperwhite that I love to pop in my bag and take everywhere with me. I have loved all of my kindles, however this one is amazing! It is faster and more stable than the last gen. The screen is gorgeous. LOVE LOVE LOVE that they made it so much  LESS weighty than the last gen. The only downside, if any, is you can't use the google play store. If you could this puppy would be perfect! As it is it's pretty darn close.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet and Huge Improvement over Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Good Points!This thing is fast!  I had an original Kindle Fire 7 inch and a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and both felt fairly sluggish compared to other tablets.  I remember reading about how revolutionary the Silk browser would be but in practical use it was much slower than other browsers.  The extra speed gained by caching certain websites was lost when the processor couldn't handle loading pages.  Not any more! With the new processor every thing on this thing flies.  going into to apps, and books and trying processor heavy actions couldn't hold it back, every thing felt really fast and I wasn't constantly waiting for things to load like I had with the previous versions of kindle fire.  It really is a noticeable difference and a huge improvement.The fire OS 3.0 is really great.  while things look similar its a fresh coat of paint that was desperately needed.  the all ways there carousel is a lot better than the favorites tray of days past.  It really does make a big difference having all the apps immediately available instead of digging through menus.Video and the screen are super clear.  HD video looks amazing and every thing on the carousel is crisp and clear.  While this is a big upside there is a small downside in that i can see pixilation in some of my comic book novels I bought on kindle.  They apparently weren't created with HD in mind and now its distracting to see pixilation when every thing else on screen is so clear.  Comixology has upgraded their app for HD comics so its not an issue their.  My comixology books look incredible.  Hopefully this is temporary and the resolution of said books will be updated (I won't hold my breath though).x-ray features are really cool.  The movie and book x-ray features are back and even better.  you can make flashcards in books, you can see every time a character or place is mentioned and simply navigate books better than ever.  I was never a fan of having to hyperlink to the table of contents then hyperlink from there to the chapter you want and hope its the right now.  Now the chapters appear within the control menu of the book so you can go directly to another chapter while not switching pages.  You can highlight in more than one color now.  The notes and other extras are all a lot better integrated and slicker than ever.  There is also goodreads integration so you can read your friends reviews, write reviews from in the book, and see general good reads reviews as well all within the book.  The music x-ray is cool, you can now karaoke along with lyrics of songs you own.  It feels gimmicky but its nice to have and once there is better mirrorcast functionality its cool you can have impromptu karaoke sessions.  The movies x-ray is improved too.  Now you can go directly to famous quotes and trivia scenes via hyperlink.  Trivia from IMDB now shows up along with the actors/actresses that are on screen.  All and all lots of good improvements here.Mayday is all right.  I did it as a test run when I got it and while its nice its there I doubt i'll ever need it again.  It is nice that I could recommend a kindle fire to older non-tech savvy relatives and they have an easy tech support outlet that isn't me.Not so GoodApps, apps, apps.  Same complaint with every model in that you don't get the complete android app store.  While they are getting better at getting bigger apps there are still a slew of what I would consider top priority apps I can't get.  There is the entire google suite which we will pretty much never get our hands on but also apps like marvel comics unlimited, weight watchers, uverse, darkhorse comics, dropbox, etc. which have an android app but not in the amazon store.  I have been sideloading them on with varying degrees of success but it is frustrating to know the app exists but you are locked out of it.  This alone is the biggest downside of the kindle fire experience.  If I had access to all these apps it'd be a 5 out of 5 with just beaming radiance of amazon love.Long term upgrades.  With this being the third generation its clear that after a year you aren't going to get upgrades or support for your kindle.  I can understand when you upgrade the processor like you do for this iteration that putting fire os 3.0 might now be possible on the kindle fire HD 8.9 but there are a lot of things they could have upgraded they didn't.  The kindle reading app on the kindle fire hd 8.9 is inferior to the reading app on the ipad.  This just shouldn't be the case.  when you add features like multicolor highlighting and x-ray it should be across the line of devices.  While I love my kindle now there is real fear that in a year it will be missing cool new features and I know I will never get them.  It makes the iPad a lot better looking device when you know you'll have at least two and maybe more years of support to follow.Lack of Chromecast/screen share.  Maybe this will get better down the line but with out a hdmi output the solution of being able to mirrorcast your screen has a utter lack of support.  There are a couple of dongles you can by to use this feature and apparently future Samsung TV's will support it but as of now that's it.  The Fire Netflix app supports chromecast but the HBOGO app doesn't.  Amazon needs to get release its own screencast device and support chromecast fully to give people options.Battery life seems better all though it does drain a lot of battery while in stand by.  With my ipad if in stand by it'll last like a week, with my kindle fire a good 20-30% battery is lost if I leave it on and asleep all day.  usage battery life is up which is nice but like I said its a pain when I pick it up at the end of the day and find the battery is dead or close to dead.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Will not be buying that new laptop, this tablet does everything I need.  I stream movies, read books, get great special offers,listen to music, play a few games. I do have a desktop I still use, but would not trade this tablet.  Great for travel. All my apps and email and books are at a  touch.

Reviews.Title: Bluetooth problem and fix
Reviews.Author: Farron D. Brougher
Reviews.Content: My comments will not duplicate the many through reviews already posted and are specific to a Bluetooth pairing problem that turned out to be easy to solve. My Phiaton PS 210 BTNC earbuds paired to two earlier generation Kindles on the first try, but not only wouldn't pair with the HDX but weren't even recognized. The solution: read the manual.I actually read and followed the simple steps provided by Phiaton--for the first time--and pairing worked on the first try. I should add that Amazon Mayday and a referral to a "Kindle generalist" were helpful and patient, superb customer service.

Reviews.Title: Not just the affordable tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: Even Amazon's own commercials portray it as the cheap alternative to the iPad, but I think they do their product a disservice selling that way. It's a great device. Easy to learn, easy to use & a pretty good selection of free apps. I had some crashing issues with a few, but nothing I haven't seen with most smartphones as well. Working with Amazon Prime Video is also a huge benefit. So if you're shopping for tablets, don't look at this as a "you get what you pay for" price shopping deal, look at it as a a true rival to the iPad that happens to be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but the software needs some work still.
Reviews.Author: J. Savage
Reviews.Content: Pro: HardwareIt's a good buy for the price. It also has USB which the iPad is known to lack to make life easier.Cons: the SoftwareLimited file types supported and you have to basically trick it to installing a different web browser just to install the missing Flash compatibility that the Silk browser lacks. It can separate your imported files (pictures video etc) into their own folders, but it isn't up front about it so you have to go through a couple menus to get the folders instead of just tapping the Photos section.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Juli
Reviews.Content: I really like the bigger screen and lower price.  I debated buying the iPad air but I am very happy I went with the Kindle Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Great kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Cate
Reviews.Content: I have tried all of the new kindle fires: new kindle fire hd, kindle fire 7" hdx, and the kindle fire hdx 8.9.  All three of the new kindle fire family are amazing tablets. I picked to keep the kindle hdx 8.9 because it meets more of my needs. Reason one I do online classes so I need large screen to view courses and to view word documents. Reason two I both like reading and watching videos which it is great for both.Theses are reason why I chose the kindle fire hdx 8.9 but all of other kindle fire are wonderful too. But the kindle fire hdx 8.9 is the perfect tablet for me.

Reviews.Title: She Loves It
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My wife is on her Kindle all the time. The HDX was a birthday/anniversary present and she has been like a little kid waiting for it to arrive.

Reviews.Title: Best Fire Yet
Reviews.Author: Book Lover "Linda"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the originalFire and really have enjoyed using it.  The new HDX is a wonderful tablet and exceeds my expectations.  The camera is great, the videos and movies watched on the Fire have excellent clarity, and the aps available are also good.  I can't say enough about this new Fire and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a step above tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best value
Reviews.Author: Arun Dongre
Reviews.Content: After comparing with other tablets chose this for good value. More bang for bucks. Clean looks and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Definite plus upgrade
Reviews.Author: Elda B. Hueth "Erae"
Reviews.Content: Glad we got this.  Someone gave me one for a present a few years ago and about the only thing I did on it was read.  This one has a lot more features and we got two - one for me and one for my husband.  Been having fun with them and still use it for reading also.

Reviews.Title: Best One Yet
Reviews.Author: Doug Graham
Reviews.Content: It's faster and lighter than the previous generation and the power and volume buttons are much more accessible. It also has more RAM which really helps with web pages loading more quickly.

Reviews.Title: Awesomeness
Reviews.Author: Keri Palmer
Reviews.Content: Nice touch Kindle! Books, movies, music and there is so much more !! Keeps the kids happy also ! Just need a hammock !

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: kfo58
Reviews.Content: The clarity of the screen is amazing. I haven't watched any movies but so far I am loving the new Kindle

Reviews.Title: omg!  iT IS FANTASTIC.
Reviews.Author: Andy Zill
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with my Kindle, it is SO easy to use. I don't have problems with glitches, or freezing up. Set up was a complete breeze. Can hardly wait to see what Amazon can do with a smartphone!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle All the Way...!!!
Reviews.Author: Pavan Deshpande
Reviews.Content: Simply the Best Product.I liked the Design and quality is too gud and i think its The best of the best...

Reviews.Title: kindle hdx
Reviews.Author: Izzy
Reviews.Content: I am loving my new kindle HDX! Easy to use. Everything off my previous kindle was automatically there! Love it!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Tracy Johnson
Reviews.Content: Thought I loved my Kindle HD, but the HDX is so much better and lighter weight (not that they weigh alot to begin with).  Go no where without my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: enhancing the usability of a gift is a must
Reviews.Author: AFJohnson
Reviews.Content: High quality back-ups and enhancing the usability of a gift is a must in my book.I recommend not going for the cheapest support items for a major gift.No corners cut here.  I recommend supporting flexibility and functions.

Reviews.Title: Vastly different than my prior Kindle, which was First Generation model
Reviews.Author: Linda T. Folsom
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to it as this is my first experience with this type of device.  A little disappointed it did not come with any directions other than "connect with wireless".  Quality of screen images is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Debbi "justdebbi"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 to just get the upgraded version because I read a LOT.. I don't really use a lot of the features it offers but I like that I can if I want.. I have the HDX 8.9" and HD 7" and love both of them..

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet!
Reviews.Author: K Sheets
Reviews.Content: I was astounded at the quality of the camera and video!  Also it's very easy to use.. still learning it... Love the mayday app!  Have almost clicked it but just knowing it's there is great!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9",
Reviews.Author: Allen S Doxakis
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product. It does everything that I expected and even more. I strongly suggest you buy one from Amazon too.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Marcy Chizmar
Reviews.Content: An awesome little machine.  So far it is one of the best purchases I have made.  I haven't even begun to know all of the things that it can do!

Reviews.Title: 2nd Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First, I really like my new Kindle Fire HDX.  It does everything I need it to do, and it does it with clarity and speed.  I'm also very pleased with the screen and sound quality.  Thank you Amazon, well done!

Reviews.Title: Size and weight fantastic
Reviews.Author: jennifer hibb
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the quality of the product, it met all my expectations. It is really an improvement on the kindle fire, I use it mainly for reading and have no complaint. It was really worth the money I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: I am extremely happy
Reviews.Author: Arline Declue "babywaif"
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing. Fast and easy to download. The only exception I have is I cannot download my music from my computer. I guess you have to pay, and pay

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: wrdrichard
Reviews.Content: I have played this tablet for some time. I'm pleased with it.It's screen is very perfect.The fire os can be used very well.But I'm not satisfied with the used time of the battery .If the used time can be longer,I think the tablet is very very perfect.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Jaci Black
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my fire. I experience  absolutely  no eye strain when reading for several hours. I chose this over the ipad and I am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 HDX Display, Wi-Fi 64GB
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This Tablet exceeded my expectation. I use this tablet more than I uses the I-Pad due to it being just as clear, but more GB"sI feels that it's the best on the market for the money.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: rosarioit
Reviews.Content: Good quality. The kindle fire is a good device. There should be more products available. Probably having more choice would be better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: NorGY
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my Mom.  She is in her 70's. She loves to read and loves word games.  She cant put it down!!

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Laurie Cole
Reviews.Content: After purchasing the HD's for my granddaughters, I was so impressed that I decided to purchase the HDX for myself.  I wanted the HDX mainly for the camera.  I am able to put my photos from my phone and my computer on to the Kindle, using Amazon Cloud.  It's great!  Very lightweight.  (The only thing I was discouraged with was that I couldn't load my favorite game - PopCats - apparently it's not compatible.  No big deal.  I'm not a game-playing person but I like playing it on the HD so hoped I could also play it on the HDX.)

Reviews.Title: #1 product for the money!
Reviews.Author: Radar999
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews for several months I decided to get this tablet.  Glad I did.  Very light, Mayday is great, tried it once to see if it worked as advertised.  Great product.  Amazon is great!

Reviews.Title: What could have been an excellent tablet, spoilt by minor niggles.
Reviews.Author: John Shorter
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle on the strength of favourable reviews I had seen, particularly the praise for sound quality.  Well, the quality may be acceptable, with earphones, but the volume is certainly not.  Other annoying features are that the contents, and features, of Skype, and Facebook do not match those on my desktop.  Particularly annoying is being unable to delete Skype contacts. The facility is there, but, it does not work!  A box appears, asking if you want to delete the contact, but clicking on it does nothing.  I have reloaded Skype twice recently, so have the latest version, it still does not work.  With the Facebook app, contacts are not listed alongside the home page, as on the desktop version.  Another minor annoyance is inconsistent loading time.  On some occasions it can take minutes, from switching on, others it "wakes up" instantly.

Reviews.Title: learning the tablet
Reviews.Author: marcias1
Reviews.Content: Coming off a sony e reader it is taking me a while to master the functions on the kindle.  The one function i find poor is that when no wifi is available and you have to use a usb port to transfer books from your computer to your device.  The steps are tedious and require to many processes to accomplish a single function. With the sony reader it was done in  2 steps whereas amazon you need several steps and if one is not computer knowledgeable it appears to be very complcated;

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product
Reviews.Author: Evan Fournaris
Reviews.Content: We consulted Consumer Reports and found that this product was highly rated anda Best Buy. It has certainly lived up to its reputation. Great display and flexibility.We also had rave reviews from friends who own this product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: David Orrino
Reviews.Content: This device is becoming my right hand.  I always have it around.  I don't do a lot of gaming but I use it for Internet access, reading books,  mail, calendar, almost everything.  I'm almost never on my PC anymore.  The only problem I have with this device, and it is not  a problem with the Kindle is that Evernote will not work properly on it.  I am a heavy Evernote user and Evernote works on my PC and iOS devices but it corrupts my notes on my Kindle.  Evernote support is silent.  Amazon has been helpful but this is an Evernote issue.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Marhanka
Reviews.Content: I've had this for several weeks now, and while I haven't had the chance to use it as much as I had intended, it has been quite pleasurable when I have used it.  The screen looks amazing, everything is nice and responsive.  It was also a pleasure to open it, as has been my experience with many Amazon products, things packed very thoughtfully.  My only complaint thus far has been with the Apps, in that some basic things I expected to have easy access to I do not, such as Youtube.

Reviews.Title: really love my new Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sheila
Reviews.Content: The new 8.9 Kindle Fire HDX is outstanding. The display clarity is outstanding. This is a versatile tablet with a very strong battery unlike previous tablets I have owned. I would recommend it over other tablets including the IPAD. It is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: AniaNY
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle and by far the best one. It is lighter than the previous version, has collection for my books - HD does not have, even ed n I can take pictures. The main reason I bought was for books and the internet; however, there are much more options with HDX.

Reviews.Title: A great way to catch up with the rest of the 21st century.
Reviews.Author: glen barry banks
Reviews.Content: An amazing device that pretty much does away with the need for a home computer in most cases. It can be murder on your phone bill but it makes up for it with so many different uses.

Reviews.Title: don't expect help when you have problems
Reviews.Author: Nancy Lister
Reviews.Content: I asked for help through the May day button on my Kindle.  The Lady became upset with me and when we ended the help session, she reset my Kindle to the default settings.  I lost all of the movies and tv shows I had downloaded.  I once again accessed the May day button, I was told that the representAtive had not ever heard of that happening before therefore she could not help me with that problem

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Carol Elaine
Reviews.Content: My daughter has a Book Nook and tried talking me into getting one instead of the Kindle because of the price.  After a lot of research and comparison sites, I chose the KIndle and never looked back.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: S. Luna "Luna"
Reviews.Content: I have not had this long enough to truly say its all wonderful. However what I have experienced so far has been Great! The help line has been wonderful. I am not a gadget person & was on the fence about getting one. I went to the local store that carries them & I tried them all. Hands down this one was the only one I could pick up & make work. I knew we could be friends! Thanks for having such an easy to use product & are willing to help me on the spot with your help button. Love it! This product has exceeded my expectations & I am thrilled I picked the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Nice upgrade from 7in.
Reviews.Author: Paul S. Kent
Reviews.Content: Larger screen is nice.  Still trying to figure out some of the operations. Battery life is less than I expected.

Reviews.Title: The HDX is AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Peggy T. "Pegs Quest"
Reviews.Content: This is actually my third Kindle.  I purchased the Kindle Fire 7" initially, thinking that it would be everything I ever wanted.  But then the bigger one came out and was HD so I purchased it.  (I gave the other one to my husband and it works well for his needs.)  Again, I thought the HD 9" Kindle would be all I needed and loved it, but then the HDX came out and had even more capabilities that I could use.  One of the most important reasons why I bought the HDX is because it is thinner and weighs less than the Kindle HD.  The picture/screen is more resilient and the other driving reason I bought it is because of the camera - not just a front facing one (which is an app on the HD camera) but is a real camera with zoom and video and other capabilities.  The one main issue that is somewhat of a negative however is that nowhere does it tell you that if you want to watch a movie by connecting to the TV, you have to purchase an additional 'unit' (I spent $60 for it).  I thought that the 'adapter' I bought for the Kindle HD would work just fine - but no, it is entirely incompatible with the HDX!  Bottom line - the HDX is awesome - just do your research and get all the needed components along with it.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet....
Reviews.Author: johwalty
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many different tablets, I found myself most interested in the Kindle Fire HDX with the larger 8.9" screen. Not totally knowing what to expect, I also took advantage of the free 30 day Prime trial along with my order. I found the Kindle well made, very user friendly, and offering all the content advertised. The sound is very good and videos are a pleasure to watch. I would recommend this highly.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Judy Grace Hanning
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS TABLET! Clear picture, fast, great design, easy to download, sleek design, big enough to read but not to big to hold. GLAD I ordered it!

Reviews.Title: finally gave in to temptation
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A. Higgins
Reviews.Content: Finally gave in and bought Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. omg I am loving it. Works wonderful right out of the box. Love I can download many of my prime movies to watch while traveling. Great for ready and the resolution is so easy on the eyes. So glad I gave in to temptation.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Heather Watts
Reviews.Content: love it....great price,  if you have any problems you call right from your kindle.  But you won't have any!!!Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: CWN
Reviews.Content: Strong 5 star rating for product and service. I love it. I wouldn't leave home without it. Easily portable. Beautiful screen and features. Super fast. Just love it is about all I can say.

Reviews.Title: neat tablet
Reviews.Author: carl gauntt
Reviews.Content: Good tablet.would be better with a 10 inch screen.no complaints.real thin and light. Key board is very responsive. Nice bright screen.

Reviews.Title: My rating on the Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Barbara Luckenbill
Reviews.Content: So far I am loving my Kindle Fire HDX and the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I do not know the full potential of it as yet. I am very much still in the learning process. When I become for familiar with it, it will probably rate the other star.

Reviews.Title: Best Investment Ever
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I enjoy reading and this table is the best for down loading books and ext. books view was really good, I didn’t want it to put the device down. you'll enjoy it buy it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: janice
Reviews.Content: I love it . it is easy to use. takes nice picture , can take it with me . the size is perfect . i can fit it in my bag. the price was great as well. the special offers do not brother me at the least.

Reviews.Title: Day to Day Routine
Reviews.Author: P. Patterson "Pannp"
Reviews.Content: This has become such a big part of my day to day routine!  I LOVE my Kindle Fire.  This has been integrated into just about every aspect of my day to day life.  I use it for watching tutorial on cooking while cooking in the kitchen, I use it for a quick search on the internet, reading, listening to music, shopping for deals on Amazon (lol).  I rarely turn on my laptop when I am at home because of my Kindle. It is lightweight, the perfect size, long battery life, brilliant color, and the price it pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: Best Kindle For Streaming Video Yet
Reviews.Author: Steele Magnolia
Reviews.Content: Pros (compared to previous model kindles):1. Longer battery life2. Lightweight for the size3. Lots of great apps4. Easy video streaming (network apps, NETFLIX, YOUTUBE, etc)5. Faster CPU response times than previous models6. Larger storage capacity7. Better internet browser8. Louder and clearer soundCons:1. Amazon Fire Video app - THERE STILL ISN'T ONE!I love this new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" and am glad that I bought it. For the price it was a great deal, comparable if a bit smaller in size than my husband's iPad and considerably less expensive. It has all the functionality I wanted and I'm glad that I got it. I will recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX versus Samsung Pro Tab 10.1
Reviews.Author: William H. Weller
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Kindle and E-books, but I also wanted a tablet. I decided to replace my older Kindle with a Kindle Fire HDX WiFi only. I liked the size, weight, and the brilliant display, but the browser, speed, and app utility didn't meet my expectations. I'll admit that I'm spoiled with my Samsung Galaxy 4s smart phone and the Android OS. The familiarity of the Android system was a bit too much for the Kindle Fire HDX to overcome, and I returned it after frustration with some apps I wanted to use. I replaced the Kindle with the Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 10.1 WiFi only. It's just the right size, has a brilliant screen, and has all the familiar Android features. The battery life is good and audio levels are adequate. All my favorite apps are downloaded and working. If you're looking for an E-reader with some browser capabilities, the Kindle Fire HDX may be just fine. But if you're looking for a more functional tablet, keep looking. As a side note, the Amazon return policy and my new order for the Galaxy worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is the best of all!
Reviews.Author: Virginia K Glass
Reviews.Content: The screen is amazing. Takes great pictures. Sound is wonderful Love the size. Buy it you will be so happy you did.

Reviews.Title: VERY SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I would have given it five-stars but nobody walks on water.  I listen to music; I watch video; I surf the Net, and I still get to read all my Kindle purchases.  JB

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle.... but...
Reviews.Author: drbrent
Reviews.Content: I got this for everything it does... but one deal breaker for me so far has been a very low quality audio out connection.  I have tried every headphone and audio cable I have and cannot get a halfway respectable audio transmission from the kindle fire hdx to my speakers or other devices with an mp3 player input on them.  I'm really not happy about this.  They are shipping me a new one to see if it will work better but I've seen online customer reviews (after I purchased of course) that claim widespread problems with the audio out functionality.  I really don't want to have to purchase an iPad or a Galaxy...  I want a Kindle darn it all.*****  Update  *****The replacement kindle fire hdx was an improvement... must have been a bad unit I received at first.  Still, the audio is not as good as a dedicated mp3 player, but it is not too bad.  Overall, I'm happy with my Kindle.  :)

Reviews.Title: Great reader
Reviews.Author: Harry Weidlich
Reviews.Content: Love the added utility comparable to I-pad. It's handy light weight and size makes it a great device. Also. I carry my whole library with me wherever I go!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 tablet is beyond super!!
Reviews.Author: Fred Bolanda
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time customer that has previously had all the Kindle Fire versions. Bought the HDX because I wanted an IPAD style camera among other things. I got the HDX a week ago and it has blown me away. First of all, the weight is so light and also the battery is great. I played a video with the brightness all the way up and I got like ten hours with the WIFI off(the WIFI drains a lot of battery by the way so keep it off if your not on the web). The screen resolution is like BLURAY quality but also a great tip is that if you're watching an SD video, put it at least five feet from you and the brightness all the way up and it's very close to HD quality. It's very smooth and fast when scrolling around the screen. Love that they finally included a rapid charger. Nothing bad to say but are a couple of things they could improve on but are really minor. If you want a tablet with a great movie experience, there is no other better tablet on the market!!! Amazon rules!!!!

Reviews.Title: Buggy so far - please help!
Reviews.Author: J. Sembower "JS"
Reviews.Content: I just got the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" for my birthday, as I'm upgrading from a 1st Gen iPad.  I want to love this thing, but so far, the experience has not been what I've expected from Amazon.Within a few hours of receiving the unit:1. Became unusable (froze) multiple times.2. Discovered that the readily available Economist App for Android doesn't exist on the Mojito platform.3. the WSJ app is buggy (crashed twice)4. Downloaded the Kindle Fire HDX update - hoping that would solve my issues, but did not help.5. Learned that the top back of the unit gets super hot when operating normally.Things I like:1. Email - works great.2. X-ray for Music - super cool.3. Books - awesome.4. Text to Speech - Even awesome-er.I'd love for someone to reach out and help me make my experience better.  I don't want to return the unit, but so far my experience isn't what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Tai Pan
Reviews.Content: I expected a very good Tablet , but what I got was beyond what I expected....Wonderful HD resolution , easy on the eyes , over 1000,000 apps , but I need only about 25 , and only use about 10.......The Direct Help Link, nothing can describe the Usefulness of this App , a big winner..........I'm glad I upgraded from the 7" HDX.......So much lighter and easier to handle for a 9 inch tablet......

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Charlie Robertson
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. It does everything I experienced. There is a learning curve with it but that is not a big problem. It is quite simular to my smartphone but does handle things a little differently. Most of the differences are improvements. I'm still learning but love it.

Reviews.Title: My first Kindle
Reviews.Author: happy happycustomer
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Tablet.  I really can't stop smiling, when I think about. It is lightweight.  The sound and picture quality is first rate. I love this Kindle !

Reviews.Title: Works nicely but I wish I had made the purchase 12 hours later!
Reviews.Author: R. Groh
Reviews.Content: Just missed the big price reduction by less than a day!  Bummer.  Oh, well - the gift recipient loves it and my son (who owns an iPad) even complimented me on my good choice so the important stuff is ok.  It does have a fantastic screen and works well overall.  We added a protective case for a finishing touch. Gradually learning the new 'tablet' ways!  We have used the 'MayDay' function twice and that works well.  Audio is a bit anemic (not a biggie). We'll add an external keyboard (maybe) - for now, the onscreen keyboard is getting the job done.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Paul Willson
Reviews.Content: Works great! love the "Mayday" feature.. Great Screen very vivid! Great value love the screen colors  internet works great and my email is right there.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks researching tablets.  I already owned a Galaxy 10.1 (wife's).  So considering what I wanted to use the tablet for, read books, email, a little web surfing, watching movies and tv shows while on the road and a few games, I bought the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  It's been fantastic.  Operates flawlessly.  Very fast.  I have Dish Network and using the Dish anywhere app I can a access all my recorded shows or watch live tv.  The device has a beautiful screen and great sound.  But the feature I love the most is the Mayday button!  This feature takes away all the frustration that comes with learning to use a new device.  I would recommend this device to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Laura Korte
Reviews.Content: The Kindle replaces another tablet.  The Kindle is superior in it's display.  I love it's size and everything I did with the previous tablet can be done with the Kindle and then some.  I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: LOve this Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: R. Olson "Randy2u"
Reviews.Content: There's nothing not to like on this Kindle.  It's fast, has a long battery life, works for surfing, reading, games, and some light writing duties.  I keep getting surprised with the nifty features!

Reviews.Title: Great Job!!
Reviews.Author: Donna Paradis
Reviews.Content: Great product. Having loads of fun, that the whole family can enjoy.  Don't have any complaints at all love the product alot. Thanks

Reviews.Title: A great investment
Reviews.Author: Michael Tolle
Reviews.Content: I am glad I invested in the new Kindle. This is my third Kindle and  have been happy with each one. I am still getting used to the functions but they are great. I love the games, music and the books. Don't come out with another version. I don't think I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: nao vue
Reviews.Content: Great but I have to learn how to move file to file  and folder to folder.  For the machine is great.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: tamara
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire.I have had it for exactly a week and absolutely love it!!! I do wish I would have gotten it quicker than the 8 days it took but I was just impatient to get it!

Reviews.Title: Didn't meet my expectations
Reviews.Author: Cher barrett
Reviews.Content: It really isn't meeting what I expected.  The battery life isn't what I feel it should be.  Seems like I'm plugging it in all the time.  It also crashes back to the main screen A LOT.  I'm just very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: LMA1011
Reviews.Content: The picture on this HDX is amazing. Navigation through the features is so simple, even I can use it without any trouble.  I was so impressed with it that Is signed up for Prime.

Reviews.Title: I like it- graphics are great.
Reviews.Author: Robert G. Losi
Reviews.Content: I wish that the the tablet came with an instruction manual or a PDF of one. I find the mayday feature very useful and the the agents extremely professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Fast Processor and Bright Clear Display
Reviews.Author: T. Schuhwerk
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" tablet is a very capable book reader that also functions well as a general tablet computer.  I am very pleased with the purchase and definitely recommend this tablet to anyone looking for a highly capable device at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Foot
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife to replace her smaller Kindle.  She is in LOVE!  Better picture, better sound, better everything!

Reviews.Title: Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: ShoreGirl
Reviews.Content: This is finally a reader/tablet that I  will use for a long time.. it is fast ancd the screen resolution is beautiful. I am very pleased with it. I am also happy with the battery life. I read on it a lot and the battery does not drain down like previous models did. Overall a winner !

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HDX.
Reviews.Author: Bible Thumper
Reviews.Content: Ok So some say that it is not Good for an office tool. But they must have more demands for there office than I do. Let me say though that the arguments about it not having a good office suite are false. I live by my office suit and I love the one that I have one my Kindle Fire HDX. You can get Polaris Office, King Soft Office and several others that will allow full editing of documents, Spread Sheets and Power Points. No, it is not like Microsoft Office, nor can it be. A tablet of any kind simply does not have the capacity to operate such a monster of a program. But the features and abilities of a good office app on the Kindle are nothing to sneeze at. The idea that the Kindle is a toy is anything but accurate. I have no games or movies on my K.F.HDX and just a few books. It is filled with stuff for work... that is what I got it for. I am able to transfer data back home when I am in Russia, I can do anything I need to in my documents and spreadsheets. Great Map apps, Calendars, Database apps, transfer of old docs to Kindle, Cloud apps, Bible apps, Email, Notebooks, Calculators, unit converters and other office tools, the list goes on and on. The only thing I can figure is that either some people demand more than a man who has an office in the states and has to access it overseas, or they did not spend much time looking for an app that did there job right. Oh, and most of my apps were free.

Reviews.Title: Fast with endless apps!
Reviews.Author: Teacher in Ohio "mt"
Reviews.Content: I like the speed in which web pages load as well as the clear, sharp pictures and video. In the classroom my kindle has become an invaluable asset.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: ms000000 "ms000000"
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear high resolution display easy to read.....and I read a LOT!  I like the convenience of being able to check email and browse the web as well.

Reviews.Title: Malfunction of unit
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Holmes
Reviews.Content: I have a first generation Kindle Fire that has served me well.  I thought I would like a larger tablet.  I liked the size and price of the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  So I purchased one.  First, the download speed on it was much slower than on my old Kindle.  Second, after spending much time in setting it up, I found a problem with the unit.  I contacted Technical Support who were very good and spent a lot of time trying their best to solve the problem, but they could not.  The conclusion was made that there was a malfunction in the unit.  Therefore, I lost confidence in the product and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is worth purchasing!
Reviews.Author: Vera G.
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with my Kindle Fire HDX!  It's thin and light weight,  which makes it easy to carry.  Takes amazing pictures.  I have downloaded book, but haven't had a chance to read at this time.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: DJF
Reviews.Content: Product is well made.  Great display and excellent battery life.  Response time is very good.  I'm very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: katzy60
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this choice so far. Does what stated, Has what I need it for and is exactly as described.It is not to cheap but I would suggest as a top choice except for you die hard people for I-pads.

Reviews.Title: Kindle hdx 8.9
Reviews.Author: Jodi Frederick
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle hdx !! Picture Is amazing !Processor is really fast and large screen.Just upgraded from first generation.awesome. thank you

Reviews.Title: Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I would rate it higher if I could read it in the sun. Unfortunately I cannot and therefore downgrade it to "I like it"

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: H. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: The best Kindle ever. They really nailed it with this one. It's got all of the features of the "expensive" tablets at a much lower price, and it's just as nice looking. The screen is clear, the internal processor is fast,the black frame isn't a distraction, and it's just wonderful all around.

Reviews.Title: kindle opioion
Reviews.Author: Phil Cohee
Reviews.Content: have kindle reader  love it.  saw kindle advertising  and would recomm. it for sure.  not thrilled with size type but I do have some eye problems.  love the speed I get off my wi fi and kindle very fast. appreciate u giving me payment option. would have been tough to get it as I am on a fixed income. thanks amazon. next comes the case for it.  have a great one  phil

Reviews.Title: I got a lemon!
Reviews.Author: T. Grace
Reviews.Content: Got the Fire, because I had great experiences with the DX, and could easily keep my books, etc. and the reviews were good.  (Did a lot of reading about tablets.)  I needed the 4G due to needing it in some isolated locations.  First one--I went through HELL trying to activate the 4G.  Surprisingly, Verizon was beyond horrible.  I can't begin to describe how non-functional and totally not customer oriented they were.  But the Fire SIM card for Verizon wasn't functional--which was on Amazon.  Ultimately, had to get a new SIM card from Verizon and finally got it activated.  Fine.  Worked well for a week--and then slowly died!  Finally had to get another Fire from Amazon.  The new one is working fairly well now.  Not sure if the difficulties I'm having on occasion are with the Apps, or it's the Fire.  Such a bad experience initially, I'm a bit leery now.  The really fabulous thing about the Fire, though is the MayDay function!!!  If you're not a tech geek and would like some help with, well, anything about your Fire, the MayDay function is absolutely everything they say it is!  The people I've worked with have been absolutely incredible, patient, and work with you until things are solved.  Without that function, I'd probably being rating the Fire a zero right now.  I'd rate the MayDay function 10 stars!  Given my difficulties with the first Fire, I would have demanded my money back long ago without the MayDay.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Jen75
Reviews.Content: My 9 yr old took over my iPad so instead of buying another one I decided to buy this.... l love it! Super user friendly and a MUST if you're a Prime member!
